description: This is the master table that holds various accessories required for transportation, pickup and delivery. An accessory differs from a special service in that the customer has to pay for using the accessories. An example of an accessory is a refrigerator unit in a truck, that is used to transport ice creams. The accessories defined can be linked at the item level or at the location level in GC3. The logic in GC3 checks to see if an accessory is required and thus, schedules and calculates the cost accordingly.

columns.name: ACCESSORIAL_CODE_GID
columns.description: ACCESSORIAL_CODE_GID contains the unique identifier for the accessorial code used for the itinerary.

columns.name: ACCESSORIAL_CODE_XID
columns.description: ACCESSORIAL_CODE_XID contains the unique external identifier for the accessorial code used for the itinerary.

columns.name: ACCESSORIAL_DESC
columns.description: ACCESSORIAL_DESC contains a description of the accessorial on an itinerary.

columns.name: SEQUENCING_FACTOR
columns.description: This column would specify the sequence number for the given accessorial code and it would be used for sequencing the rating of the accessorial while rating.

columns.name: ROUNDING_TYPE
columns.description: The type of rounding that will occur during rating.  Value are: N=no rounding,I=round to nearest interval,F=floor, and C=ceiling.

columns.name: ROUNDING_INTERVAL
columns.description: Numbers will be rounded (or truncated) to the nearest increment of this value.

columns.name: ROUNDING_FIELDS_LEVEL
columns.description: Determines which kinds of fields will be affected by the rounding settings during costing.  Values are 0-7, where 0=all fields, 1=none, 2=numeric fields only, 3=unit fields (weight, etc.), 4=currency, 5=numeric and unit fields, 6=numeric and currency fields, and 7=unit and currency fields.

columns.name: ROUNDING_APPLICATION
columns.description: Determines when to apply the rounding rules.  Values are A/N/C/O where A=always, N=never, C=conditionals only, and O=cost calculations only.

columns.name: DEFICIT_CALCULATIONS_TYPE
columns.description: When to apply deficit calculations. Values are Y/N/P where Y = Yes, N = No and P = Payant Pour

columns.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_CODE_GID
columns.description: payment method to apply to the shipment cost when the shipment action to apply payment terms is executed

columns.name: IS_FILED_AS_TARIFF
columns.description: Indicates if this accessorial cost has been filed as tariff.  This is set to 'N' for new spot rates.  Users may wish to set up a saved query to notify users if this rate is used.

columns.name: COST_TYPE
columns.description: Designates the type of the cost.  C = Charge, D = Discount, P = Profile, E = External, L = Logic Parameter

columns.name: CALENDAR_ACTIVITY_GID
columns.description: Allows the user to select a calendar activity for the calendar validation test

columns.name: RATE_UNIT_BREAK_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The main rate unit break profile

columns.name: RATE_UNIT_BREAK_PROFILE2_GID

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMPARATOR2_GID
columns.description: The RBI used to lookup values in the secondary rate unit break profile

columns.name: EXTERNAL_RATING_ENGINE_GID
columns.description: For cost_type of E, specifies the external rating engine gid

columns.name: EXT_RE_FIELDSET_GID
columns.description: For external rating engine gids of type GENERIC, this specifies the fieldset used to call out to the external engine

columns.name: COST_CODE_GID
columns.description: Tags a cost with an accessorial code.  This does not indicate that the cost is an accessorial.  It is a way of identifying groups of costs.

columns.name: LOGIC_PARAM_QUAL_GID
columns.description: For cost_type of L, specifies the logic parameter qualifier (of type Currency) which contains the cost value used as the charge multiplier.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVE
columns.description: When 'N', indicates accessorial cost is inactive and should not be used.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER1
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the condition is based. For example, if the condition is to check value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER2
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the second condition is based. For example, if the condition is to check value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER3
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the third condition is based. For example, if the condition is to check value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER4
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the condition is based. For example, if the condition is to check value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_QUALIFIER1
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge is to be calculated. For example, if the charge is based on some flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the charge is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_QUALIFIER2
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge is to be calculated. For example, if the charge is based on some flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the charge is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMP_QUALIFIER1
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge using unit breaks is to be calculated. For example, if the rate break is based on flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the rate break is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMP_QUALIFIER2
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge using unit breaks is to be calculated. For example, if the rate break is based on flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the rate break is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

description: Table that stores accessorials to be defined globally. The global accessorial will only be applied if an accessorial with the same code exists at the rate_offering/rate_geo level which directs the rating process to use the global accessorial for it's cost.  The global (default) cost will be used if the valid accessorial defined at the rate_offering or rate_geo has no entries for it's costs.

columns.name: LRT_INTERRUPT_ON_SQL
columns.description: If 'Y', a task interruption will force the next SQL statement to fail.

columns.name: LRT_OBJECT_COUNT_THRESHOLD
columns.description: The action is only tracked as a Long Running Task if IS_LONG_RUNNING_TASK='Y' and the # of objects passed to the UI action exceeds this threshold.

description: This table specifies the activity that can occur at a location. It is used in conjunction with the Calendar table to define the date time profile for the activity. Some examples of the activity include: CLOSED DISPATCH LIVELOAD LOAD OFFICEHOURS PICKUP RECEIVE etc.

columns.name: ACTIVITY_GID
columns.description: ACTIVITY_GID contains the type of activity for which a calendar was created. Types include: 'FOO2' ACTIVATE CLOSED DISPATCH FOO LIVELOAD LOAD OFFICEHOURS PICKUP RECEIVE

columns.name: ACTIVITY_XID
columns.description: ACTIVITY_XID is the unique identifier of a pre-configured field (that is not updateable by the user) of a list of activities in G-Log. Types include: 'FOO2' ACTIVATE CLOSED DISPATCH FOO LIVELOAD LOAD OFFICEHOURS PICKUP RECEIVE

columns.name: ACTIVITY_NAME
columns.description: ACTIVITY_NAME is a pre-configured field (that is not updateable by the user) that stores the list of activities in G-Log. The ACTIVITY_NAME can be: DRIVER DISPATCHING FOO ITINERARY ACTIVATED LIVE TRAILER LOADING LOADING FREIGHT OFFICE HOURS RECEIVING FREIGHT WAREHOUSE CLOSED DOOR WAREHOUSE PICKING

If ACTIONS, both AGENT_STATS and AGENT_ACTION_STATS records are modified. Note that this value always overrides the default property-driven behavior. The default is used only if the field is left NULL.

description: This is an internal table that is used to generate Business Numbers by the business generator application logic. The rules define how the business numbers are generated. Right now since only the picture string generator is implemented, only picture string definitions are used. The user need to supply the Business number type and the Context. The BN engine locates the best matching rule definition based on rule type, domain, and the current date. After the rule definition is located the context is used to generate the business number.

columns.name: UPDATE_FLAG
columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated. If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier. If the value is either UPDATE_OK or UPDATE_NOT_OK, then the rule is in effect, meaning only one value is allowed for a given qualifier. In the case of UPDATE_NOT_OK, the value may not be modified.

description: THIS TABLE STRUCTURE IS SIMILAR TO THE INVOICE_PROTECTIVE_SERVICE TABLE.  PROTECTIVE SERVICE IS USED BY THE RAIL INDUSTRY TO COMMUNICATE TEMPERATURE REQUIREMENTS AND IS WHERE THE USER COMMUNICATES OPTIMAL TEMPERATURE FOR THE RR.  THE USER CAN SPECIFY UP TO 5 CODES THAT ARE ALL USED TOGETHER, THIS IS WHY THERE IS A SEQUENCE NUMBER INCLUDED WITHIN THE STRUCTURE.

columns.description: The protective service optimal temperature in base units.

description: Rules to determine whether an object is compatible with other objects
Holds complex expressions that could be used to build expressions using saved conditions, thresholds, boolean expressions and attribute rules using boolean connectors AND, OR.

columns.name: LOGIC_OPERATOR
columns.description: Logic operator column would hold AND/OR. Based on this operator, either all the records in detail would be anded (or) ored.  So, Logic operator would take values AND, OR.

description: This is a master table that stores the various communication methods that can be used to communicate with the locations. Some examples include: EDI E-Mail Fax Phone HTTPPOST etc.

columns.name: COM_METHOD_GID
columns.description: COM_METHOD_GID contains the unique identifier for the communication method for the location.

columns.name: COM_METHOD_XID
columns.description: COM_METHOD_XID contains the unique external identifier for the communication method for the location.

columns.name: MAX_RETRIES_ON_ERROR
columns.description: Maximum number of retries upon delivery failure.

columns.name: ALTERNATE_COM_METHOD_GID
columns.description: Alternate communication method to delivery message when retries are exhausted.

description: static data for conditional booking field specification

columns.name: DATA_TYPE
columns.description: The available values of this column should be the same as these defined in Planning_parameter_qualifer, i.e. S/B/I/N/D/G/U/C/P.

columns.name: UPDATE_FIELD_NAME
columns.description: this column capture the names of update field.  The convention is <TABLE_NAME>.<COLUMN_NAME>, i.e., SHIPMENT.TOTAL_VOLUME.  Multiple values separated by comma are allowed.

columns.name: CONSOL_GID
columns.description: The GID for the consol.

columns.name: CONSOL_XID
columns.description: The XID for the consol.

columns.name: CONSOL_TYPE
columns.description: Consol type can be Charter Voyage Stowage, Flight, or Ocean FCL.

columns.name: CHARTER_VOYAGE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the charter voyage associated with the consol. Charter voyage is assigned for consol type of Charter Voyage Stowage.

columns.name: STOWAGE_MODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the stowage mode related to this consol. Stowage modes provide a way to identify how the shipment will be stowed. When an order release is booked for a voyage, the system needs to determine the best stowage mode and subsequently the best voyage that supports that stowage mode. To determine the best stowage mode, you can create preference rules that are evaluated. This rule will, based on certain attributes on the order release, provide a preferred list of stowage modes that can be used for that order. Note: You can also define a stowage mode directly on an order and it will override any stowage mode preference rules.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_WEIGHT
columns.description: Allocated weight represents the original agreed-upon capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The allocated weight UOM qualifier e.g., LB and KG.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The allocated weight in the base UOM.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_VOLUME
columns.description: Allocated volume represents the original agreed-upon capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The allocated volume UOM qualifier e.g., CU IN.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The allocated volume in the base UOM.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_NUM_TEU
columns.description: Allocated TEU represents the original agreed-upon twenty foot equivalent unit capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: ALLOCATED_NUM_FEU
columns.description: Allocated FEU represents the original agreed-upon forty foot equivalent unit capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT
columns.description: Maximum weight represents the maximum capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The maximum weight UOM qualifier e.g., LB and KG.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum weight in the base UOM.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME
columns.description: Maximum volume represents the maximum capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The maximum volume UOM qualifier e.g., CU IN.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The maximum volume in the base UOM.

columns.name: MAX_NUM_TEU
columns.description: Maximum number of TEU represents the maximum twenty foot equivalent unit capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: MAX_NUM_FEU
columns.description: Maximum FEU represents the maximum forty foot equivalent unit capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage.

columns.name: COMMITTED_WEIGHT
columns.description: Committed weight represents the committed capacity on the pre-bookings for this stowage mode on the charter voyage. The committed weight can only be edited when the consol status is READY-TO-COMMIT.

columns.name: COMMITTED_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The committed weight UOM qualifier e.g., LB and KG.

columns.name: COMMITTED_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The committed weight in the base UOM.

columns.name: COMMITTED_VOLUME
columns.description: Committed volume represents the committed capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage. The committed volume can only be edited when the consol status is READY-TO-COMMIT.

columns.name: COMMITTED_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The committed volume UOM qualifier e.g., CU IN.

columns.name: COMMITTED_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The committed volume in the base UOM.

columns.name: COMMITTED_NUM_TEU
columns.description: Committed number of TEU represents the committed number of twenty foot equivalent unit capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage. The committed TEU can only be edited when the consol status is READY-TO-COMMIT.

columns.name: COMMITTED_NUM_FEU
columns.description: Committed FEU represents the committed number of forty foot equivalent unit capacity for this stowage mode on the charter voyage. The committed FEU can only be edited when the consol status is READY-TO-COMMIT.

columns.name: BOOKED_WEIGHT
columns.description: Represents the booked weight capacity that is booked on the voyage for shipments planned using order releases (production lot orders). These values are calculated each time an order is booked on the consol using the Build Buy Shipment on Primary Leg action (from the Order Release manager).

columns.name: BOOKED_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The booked weight UOM qualifier e.g., LB and KG.

columns.name: BOOKED_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The booked weight in the base UOM.

columns.name: BOOKED_VOLUME
columns.description: Represents the booked volume capacity that is booked on the voyage for shipments planned using order releases (production lot orders). These values are calculated each time an order is booked on the consol using the Build Buy Shipment on Primary Leg action (from the Order Release manager).

columns.name: BOOKED_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The booked volume UOM qualifier e.g., CU IN.

columns.name: BOOKED_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The booked volume in the base UOM.

columns.name: BOOKED_NUM_TEU
columns.description: Represents the booked TEU capacity that is booked on the voyage for shipments planned using order releases (production lot orders). These values are calculated each time an order is booked on the consol using the Build Buy Shipment on Primary Leg action (from the Order Release manager).

columns.name: BOOKED_NUM_FEU
columns.description: Represents the booked FEU capacity that is booked on the voyage for shipments planned using order releases (production lot orders). These values are calculated each time an order is booked on the consol using the Build Buy Shipment on Primary Leg action (from the Order Release manager).

columns.name: PRODUCED_WEIGHT
columns.description: Produced weight is a weight values that is not calculated and is user-defined.

columns.name: PRODUCED_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The produced weight UOM qualifier e.g., LB and KG.

columns.name: PRODUCED_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The produced weight in the base UOM.

columns.name: PRODUCED_VOLUME
columns.description: Produced volume is a volume values that is not calculated and is user-defined.

columns.name: PRODUCED_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The produced volume UOM qualifier e.g., CU IN.

columns.name: PRODUCED_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The produced volume in the base UOM.

columns.name: PRODUCED_NUM_TEU
columns.description: Produced TEU is a TEU value that is not calculated and is user-defined.

columns.name: PRODUCED_NUM_FEU
columns.description: Produced FEU is a FEU value that is not calculated and is user-defined.

columns.name: PERSPECTIVE
columns.description: Perspective - Buy or Sell.

columns.name: FLIGHT_INSTANCE_ID
columns.description: The flight instance ID this consol is created from when the consol is a flight consol.

columns.name: HAZMAT_TYPE
columns.description: Hazmat type. One of three values: HAZMAT ONLY, NO HAZMAT, HAZMAT ALLOWED.

columns.name: ITINERARY_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the assigned itinerary profile. The itinerary profile defines the consol's applicability to legs.

columns.name: CONSOLIDATION_TYPE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the assigned consolidation type on the consol. A consolidation type can be assigned to any order release or job for informational purposes. Consolidation types can also be included in a consolidation type profile that can then be used as criteria for the automatic assignment of non-freight related charges to a job.

columns.name: PLACE_RECEIPT_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: Specifies a place of receipt location other than the port of loading. If specified this will add a stop to the consol shipment created.

columns.name: PLACE_DELIVER_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: Specifies a place of delivery other than the port of discharge. If specified this will add a stop to the consol shipment created.

columns.name: PORT_OF_LOAD_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The port of loading for transport.

columns.name: PORT_OF_DIS_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The port of discharge for transport.

columns.name: INCO_TERM_GID
columns.description: The GID for the incoterms associated with the consol.

columns.name: SERVPROV_GID
columns.description: The GID for the carrier. If blank, look at the voyage table.

columns.name: TRANSPORT_MODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the transportation mode for the consol.

columns.name: INTENDED_VESSEL_GID
columns.description: The intended vessel gid. The vessel gid may not be in the system yet and therefore there is no foreign key restriction.

columns.name: INTENDED_VOYAGE_GID
columns.description: The intended voyage gid. The voyage gid may not be in the system yet and therefore there is no foreign key restriction.

columns.name: INTENDED_DEPARTURE_TIME
columns.description: Intended estimated time of departure.

columns.name: INTENDED_ARRIVAL_TIME
columns.description: Intended estimated time of arrival.

columns.name: FLEX_COMMODITY_QUAL_GID
columns.description: A GID to define the type of the code. E.g.. HTS, SITC, STCC, NMFC etc.

columns.name: FLEX_COMMODITY_CODE
columns.description: The user-defined commodity code. E.g.. the HTS, NMFC, SITC, STCC codes.

columns.name: ONE_SHIPMENT_PER_CONTAINER
columns.description: This flag will only be used when consol_type is OCEAN FCL. If it is 'Y', one shipment will be created for each container specified on the consol. If it is 'N', one shipment will be created for all the containers specified on the consol. The default value is 'N'.

columns.name: FLEX_COMMODITY_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The flexible commodity profile ID that associates to the consol.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_REFERENCE_UNIT_GID
columns.description: The GID for the equipment group reference unit being defined.

columns.name: MAX_NUM_REFERENCE_UNITS
columns.description: The maximum number of equipment reference units that can be held in the consol.

columns.name: MAX_NUM_EQUIPMENT
columns.description: The maximum number of equipment that can be held in the consol.

columns.name: INTENDED_GROUND_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: The intended ground service gid. The ground service gid may not be in the system yet and therefore there is no foreign key restriction.

columns.name: CUTOFF_TIME
columns.description: A duration that is subtracted from the consol shipment departure time and populated as the Operation Late Delivery Date of the previous leg order movement.

columns.name: CONSOL_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the consol group being defined.

description: Profile to determine when and how to batch messages

columns.name: TIME_WINDOW_GID
columns.description: Time window determining when to batch messages.

columns.name: SUMMARY_STYLESHEET_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Stylesheet used to generate summary message

columns.name: BATCH_SIZE
columns.description: Another way to determine when to batch messages.

description: User defined qualification table to define order and job types
Defines a set of constraints on a procurement solution in terms of which types of equipment can be used, which carriers, and which transport modes.

columns.name: ABS_MIN_CARRIER_PERF_LEVEL
columns.description: Bid is rejected if carrier's performance level is below this

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Bid is rejected if carrier bids an equipment group that inappropriate for the project, bid round, or lane

columns.name: SERVPROV_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Bid is rejected if carrier is excluded from the project, bid round, or lane

columns.name: MODE_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Bid is rejected if carrier's mode is inappropriate for the project, bid round, or lane

description: This table is used to identify a contact person at a location for communication.

columns.name: CONTACT_GID
columns.description: The GID for the contact for the location.

columns.name: CONTACT_XID
columns.description: The XID for the contact for the location.

columns.name: FIRST_NAME
columns.description: The given name of the contact person for the location.

columns.name: LAST_NAME
columns.description: The surname of the contact person for the location.

columns.name: JOB_TITLE
columns.description: The title for the contact person at the location.

columns.name: EMAIL_ADDRESS
columns.description: The email address of the contact person for the location.

columns.name: PHONE1
columns.description: The primary telephone number for the location's contact person.

columns.name: PHONE2
columns.description: The secondary telephone number for the location's contact person.

columns.name: FAX
columns.description: The facsimile number for the contact person for the location.

columns.name: LANGUAGE_SPOKEN
columns.description: The language the contact person at the location speaks.

columns.name: IS_PRIMARY_CONTACT
columns.description: Indicates if this contact person at the location is the primary contact person (if so Y) or not (if not N).

columns.name: TELEX
columns.description: The telephone number for telex communications for the location's contact person.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_GID
columns.description: The external system GID.

columns.name: NOTES
columns.description: Text describing something regarding the contact person for the location or the location itself.

columns.name: GL_USER_GID
columns.description: The GL user GID.

columns.name: RECIPIENT_DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: The domain of a message recipient.

columns.name: ROUTE_THROUGH_LOCATION
columns.description: Indicates if the notification should use location.

columns.name: CONTACT_TYPE
columns.description: Defines whether a contact is a person or group.

columns.name: IS_BROADCAST
columns.description: Valid only if the contact_type = 'GROUP'.  This is a Boolean flag which controls whether GC3 creates a single notification message and broadcasts (i.e. cc) it to each group member or whether GC3 creates a message customized for each member.

columns.name: GROUP_SAVED_QUERY_GID
columns.description: Valid only if the contact_type = 'GROUP'.  The saved_query could then define which individual contacts belong to the contact_group.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location.

columns.name: IS_EMAIL_VIRUS_PROTECTED
columns.description: If Y, document attachments may be sent to the contact without virus checking.

columns.name: CONSOLIDATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the consolidation profile.  You would enter a Consolidation Profile if you are using consolidated notification. If a consolidation profile is entered, it will apply to all contact notifications that do not have a consolidated notification profile.

columns.name: CONSOLIDATED_NOTIFY_ONLY
columns.description: Select the Consolidated Notify Only check box if the only notification sent is to be consolidated and the communication method is email, fax or message center.

columns.name: IS_NOTIFICATION_ON
columns.description: No notification will be sent to the contact if this field is set to false ('N').

columns.name: TIME_ZONE_GID
columns.description: Time zone for the contact.

columns.name: FROM_ADDR_CONTACT_GID
columns.description: The GID that contains a contact's 'From-Address' details. Valid only if IS_FROM_ADDRESS is 'N'.

columns.name: IS_FROM_ADDRESS
columns.description: Indicates if a contact is a 'From-Address' contact.

columns.name: MIDDLE_NAME
columns.description: The middle name of the contact.

columns.name: CELL_PHONE
columns.description: Contains the mobile/cell  phone number for the location's contact person.  Do not include special characters such as '+' and '-'.

columns.name: SEND_AS_MESSAGE
columns.description: Indicates that messages should be sent to message center.

columns.name: MESSAGE_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the message profile. A message profile provides a grouping of stylesheet profiles for inbound message processing. It represents the different formats a device can send to the system. A message profile is assigned to a contact. If the message type for an incoming message, the system attempts to apply the stylesheet profiles listed in the message profile. They are applied to the incoming message in the order of the Attempt Sequence of the message profile.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: ALTERNATE_NAME
columns.description: If the contact goes by an alternate name the alternate name should be entered here. For example, real name Laurence Tureaud, alternate name Mr. T. Note: GTM bases restricted party screening on the party's company name. If the contact has an alternate name, the contact's alternate name is screened instead.

columns.name: COMPANY_NAME
columns.description: Company name for this party.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Enter any additional descriptive information for this party/contact.

columns.name: IPP_PRINTER_GID
columns.description: Used to assign an IPP printer as a recipient of notifications, particularly of document or report events.

columns.name: ECM_USER
columns.description: If the contact is acting as a reviewer or subscriber to documents within Oracle ECM, the ECM user mapping to the contact.

columns.description: Indicators are icons that can be assigned to business objects that can be displayed in search Results pages and other lists to indicate the condition or state of a business object. You can use indicators to mark the history, status or any other condition of a business object.

Up to five User-Defined Image fields can be configured to appear on the Search and Results page that let you query and review the images that are assigned to a business object. Images can be assigned to business objects to visually emphasize certain characteristics such as shipments containing hazardous material, orders for hot commodities, or shipments with over dimensional freight.

columns.name: CONTAINER_RELEASE_NUMBER
columns.description: The container release number is assigned once a sea carrier receives a new booking line item. They return the container release number (CRN) corresponding to the new booking.

columns.name: REFERENCE_CODE
columns.description: This field is populated with the reference code that was entered on the unitization rule that was used to create this container.

description: Content Management System for document integration

columns.name: CONTENT_MANAGEMENT_SYSTEM_GID
columns.description: Content Management System GID

columns.name: CONTENT_MANAGEMENT_SYSTEM_XID
columns.description: Content Management System XID

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Description of system

columns.name: URL
columns.description: URL for system communication

columns.name: TYPE
columns.description: Type of CMS: 'OTM' = OTM is managing and storing documents within the schema. 'WCC' - Oracle Webcenter Content is used to manage and store documents. 'JCR' - Some other JSR-170 compliant system is used to manage and store documents.

columns.name: USER_NAME
columns.description: User name for remote authorization

columns.name: PASSWORD
columns.description: Credentials for remote authorization

columns.name: WCC_SUPPORTS_ACCOUNTS
columns.description: If 'Y', WCC has been configured to support accounts.

columns.name: WCC_USE_DIRECT_URL
columns.description: If 'Y', users receive direct URL's into WCC, necessitating an SSO solution or login to WCC. If 'N', content is piped through OTM.

columns.name: WCC_USE_AUTO_GENERATED_ID
columns.description: If 'Y', WCC has been configured to auto generated document ID's.

columns.name: WCC_SECURITY_GROUP
columns.description: The default security group for documents.

columns.name: WCC_DOCNAME_GEN_GID
columns.description: The default generator for the dDocName WCC parameter.

columns.name: WCC_DOCTITLE_GEN_GID
columns.description: The default generator for the dDocAccount WCC parameter.

columns.name: WCC_ACCOUNT_GEN_GID
columns.description: The default generator for the dDocAccount WCC parameter.

columns.name: WCC_REVLABEL_GEN_GID
columns.description: The default generator for the dRevLabel WCC parameter.

columns.name: WCC_REVIEW_MODE
columns.description: If 'NONE', no document review workflows are used with the CMS. If 'WCC', OTM forwards reviewers to WCC which is responsible for managing the review process. Users can accept or deny documents from OTM, but the action is forwarded to WCC. If 'OTM', standard OTM review workflow is used. Documents cannot be accept or denied from WCC.

columns.name: WCC_DISTRIBUTION_MODE
columns.description: If 'NONE', no document distribution is used with the CMS. If 'WCC', OTM forwards distribution parties to WCC which is responsible for forwarding them finalized content. Users can finalize or unfinalize documents from OTM, but the action is forwarded to WCC. If 'OTM', standard OTM finalization workflow is used. Documents cannot be finalized from WCC.

columns.name: JCR_CONNECTION_TYPE
columns.description: Type of connection to retrieve a JSR-170 Repository. 'JNDI' assumes the content server supports JNDI lookup. 'SERVICE LOADER' assumes libraries to support the content server are included with OTM. 'JAVA' assumes a proprietary connection is needed.

columns.name: JCR_CONNECTION_PLUGIN_GID
columns.description: If the JCR connection type is 'JAVA', the plugin to retrieve a JCR Repository object.

columns.name: JCR_SUPPORTS_REVISIONS
columns.description: If 'Y', the JSR-170 compliant CMS supports document versioning

columns.name: ROOT_FOLDER
columns.description: Root folder for all OTM documents. If null, documents are assumed unfiled.

columns.name: FOLDER_TYPE
columns.description: Type of folders for document assignment. If NONE, documents are assumed unfiled. If FIXED, all documents are placed in the root folder. If DOMAIN, documents are placed in a subfolder of the root, equal to the domain. E.g., a document in domain A/B ,with a root of R, is placed in R/A/B. If GENERATED, the subfolder is determined by a parameter generator.

columns.name: FOLDER_GEN_GID
columns.description: The parameter generator for document subfolders.

columns.name: CMIS_BINDING
columns.description: CMIS Binding. If WEB SERVICES, Web Service calls over SOAP are used to invoke CMIS. If ATOM PUB, RESTful calls are used.

columns.name: CMIS_USE_VERSIONING
columns.description: If Y, the CMIS versioning implementation should be used when adding OTM revisions. Otherwise, an independent document is created for each revision.

columns.name: CMIS_NAME_GEN_GID
columns.description: Generator for the cmis:name parameter.

columns.name: CMIS_REVLABEL_GEN_GID
columns.description: Generator for the cmis:versionLabel parameter.

columns.name: CMIS_REPOSITORY_ID
columns.description: CMIS repository ID. If left blank, OTM will use the first repository found.

columns.name: FOLDER_CMS_TYPE
columns.description: Custom folder CMS type.

columns.name: DOCUMENT_CMS_TYPE
columns.description: Custom document CMS type.

columns.name: ODC_DOCTITLE_GEN_GID
columns.description: This column would store the param generator gid to generate  title for documents

columns.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_GID
columns.description: External System ID providing the connection details to Content Management System. For example, For connecting with Microsoft Graph API using OAuth authorization.

columns.name: DRIVE_ID
columns.description: Drive ID for accessing the document library of a user (OneDrive), Group, or SharePoint Site for SharePoint Online using Microsoft Graph API.

columns.name: JAVA_PLUGIN_GID
columns.description: Java implementation of interface to external system. Implements MessageSourceInterface.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_GID
columns.description: Contains user and connectivity details for use by plugin to retrieve messages

columns.name: COM_METHOD_GID
columns.description: Communication method to use for transport

description: This table is used in conjunction with the Location table. It contains the additional details about the location that is a corporation. It contains the Billing and Remittance information.

columns.name: CORPORATION_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the corporation.

columns.name: CORPORATION_XID
columns.description: Contains the XID for the corporation.

columns.name: CORPORATION_NAME
columns.description: Contains the name of the corporation.

columns.name: IS_DOMAIN_MASTER
columns.description: Check box field to identify a corporation record as the domain master.  The domain master corporation determines the default involved parties for an order, given the domain of the order. When a shipment is built, it grabs the LOGISTICS involved party from the master corporation for the domain and adds it to the shipment. It also does the same for the order for BILL-TO, LOGISTICS, ORDEROWNER, ORDERSUPPLIER, SHIPPER, CONSIGNEE when the order is created. Also, when trying to get the primary contact for a shipment tender, Oracle Transportation Management looks for a contact that is associated to the master corporation for the domain and the service provider.

columns.name: IS_SHIPPING_AGENTS_ACTIVE
columns.description: Indicates if corporation is active. Used with agents.

columns.name: IS_ALLOW_HOUSE_COLLECT
columns.description: The Allow House Collect check box field is used to indicate whether or not a shipping agent is allowed to handle shipments with COLLECT payment terms.  Note: This check box is used for visibility and is not currently enforced within the base application i.e., this is for information only.

columns.name: MAX_HOUSE_COLLECT_AMT
columns.description: If house collection is allowed,  the Max House Collect Amount is used to specify the maximum amount of freight charges that can be collected from the internal bill.

columns.name: MAX_HOUSE_COLLECT_CURRENCY_GID
columns.description: The GID that qualifies the  currency for the Max House Collect Amount.

columns.name: MAX_HOUSE_COLLECT_AMT_BASE
columns.description: The Max House Collect Amount in the base currency.

columns.name: PICKUP_ROUTING_SEQUENCE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the pickup routing sequence. The Pickup Routing Sequence control the routing sequence; how the system plans the sequence of shipment stops that are built from an order base.

columns.name: DROPOFF_ROUTING_SEQUENCE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the dropoff routing sequence. The Dropoff Routing Sequence controls the routing sequence; how the system plans the sequence of shipment stops that are built from an order base.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

description: This table is used to create enumerated groups of corporations. It creates a qualifier for the corporation to group them accordingly. Multiple corporations can be a part of a single or more corporation profiles. This table also stores the compatibility information between corporation profiles.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_XID
columns.description: CORPORATION_PROFILE_XID contains the unique external identifier for the coroporation profile.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_NAME
columns.description: CORPORATION_PROFILE_NAME contains the name for the corporation'sprofile.

description: This table is used to resolve the many-to-many relationship between the corporations and corporation profiles. A corporation can be part of one or more corporation profiles.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID contains the unique identifier for the corporation profile.

columns.name: CORPORATION_GID
columns.description: CORPORATION_GID contains the unique identifier for the corporation.

description: COUNTRY_CODE stores a three-digit code for every country, which is standard data for the countries. This table also stores (for reference only) two-digit codes for those countries that have them. GC3 always uses the three-digit code country code.

columns.name: COUNTRY_CODE3_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: COUNTRY_CODE3_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

columns.name: COUNTRY_NAME
columns.description: COUNTRY_NAME contains the country name.

columns.name: COUNTRY_ZONE_GID
columns.description: COUNTRY_ZONE_GID contains the unique identifier for the country zone. Zones can include: AFR ANT ASI AUS CAM CAR EAF EUR FAR MID NAM NPL SAF SAM SAO

columns.name: IS_EU_MEMBER_COUNTRY
columns.description: Indicates if country is member of European Union.

columns.name: VALIDATE_POSTAL_CODE
columns.description: This flag should be set to 'Y' if address validation has been loaded into the POSTAL_CODE_VALIDATE table for this particular country.

columns.name: CAR_REGISTRATION_CODE
columns.description: 1-3 character car registration code.

columns.name: IS_INSPECTION_REQUIRED
columns.description: Inspection is required for this country. Default is 'N'

columns.name: IS_COLLECT_ALLOWED
columns.description: Collect is allowed for this country. Default is 'Y'

columns.name: BOL_TYPE
columns.description: BOL Type. Copied down to shipment

columns.name: BOL_ISSUANCE_TYPE
columns.description: BOL Issuance Type. Copied down to shipment

columns.name: IS_MEMO_BL_ALLOWED
columns.description: Indicate if this country allows Memo B/L

columns.name: IATA_REGION
columns.description: The IATA region code for this country.  Will be 1, 2, or 3

description: Additional zone information for the country. Multiple countries can be part of a zone.

columns.name: COUNTRY_ZONE_GID
columns.description: COUNTRY_ZONE_GID contains the unique identifier for the country zone. Zones can include: AFR ANT ASI AUS CAM CAR EAF EUR FAR MID NAM NPL SAF SAM SAO

columns.name: COUNTRY_ZONE_XID
columns.description: COUNTRY_ZONE_XID contains the unique external identifier for the country zone.

columns.description: For long running tasks, determines if the task should be pulled out of the data queue only when resources are available to process it. description: DM_TRANSACTION_REFNUM_QUAL contains the qualifier and description of additional information associated with an demurrage transaction, such as BILL OF LADING, WAY BILL ID. The actual values are stored in DM_TRANSACTION_REFNUM.

columns.name: DEFAULT_REFNUM_BN_TYPE_GID
columns.description: The BN type used to generate a refnum when the refnum field for a record in the corresponding refnum table is not populated.

columns.name: UPDATE_FLAG
columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated. If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier. If the value is either UPDATE_OK or UPDATE_NOT_OK, then the rule is in effect, meaning only one value is allowed for a given qualifier. In the case of UPDATE_NOT_OK, the value may not be modified.

columns.name: MARKED_FOR_PURGE
columns.description: A boolean field. When it is set to 'Y', this row and its child data will be purged.

description: Document validation rule

columns.name: DOCUMENT_DEF_GID
columns.description: Document Type

columns.name: SAVED_CONDITION_GID
columns.description: Saved condition - must be met for validation to pass.

columns.name: ERROR_TRANSLATION_GID
columns.description: If validation fails, an error message to display.

columns.name: SOLUTION_TRANSLATION_GID
columns.description: If validation fails, a solution message to display.

columns.name: REVIEW_STATUS
columns.description: State of document to apply validation. Validation can be applied when a document is being previewed, reviewed, finalized or indepedent of state.

columns.name: XPATH_ROOT
columns.description: Root of XPath testing. This is based on the integration XML of the document's business object.

columns.name: XPATH_TEST
columns.description: XPath condition, relative to the XPath root, that must be met for validation. If the condition is on a child branch, it must validate for all matching branches.

columns.name: AUTO_ASSIGN_RULE_GID
columns.description: If validation fails, an auto assign rule to force a default value onto the document.

columns.name: DOCUMENT_DEF_CHECK_GID
columns.description: Unique ID for the validation rule

columns.name: DATA_QUERY_TYPE_GID
columns.description: data query type for which the document validation applies to in the document definition

description: The table holds document set details.

columns.name: REPLY_TO_CONTACT_GID
columns.description: The reply-to contact for email notification. This is not retrieved from the object and will be used for all of the objects to which this document set is assigned.

columns.name: ZIP_DOCUMENTS
columns.description: Indicates whether the documents are to be compressed to a zip file or sent as individual documents in the email.

columns.name: SEND_PARTIAL_DOC_TYPES

description: A set of rights and assumptions defining the uploading and viewing of documents.

columns.description: If Y, users with this profile may upload documents to GC3

columns.description: If Y, users with this profile may upload documents to GC3 without needing a virus check.

columns.name: IS_BROWSER_VIRUS_PROTECTED

columns.name: USER_DEFINED1_ICON_GID
columns.description: The GID for the user defined image/icon. Up to five User-Defined Image fields can be configured to appear on the Search and Results page that let you query and review the images that are assigned to a business object. Images can be assigned to business objects to visually emphasize certain characteristics such as shipments containing hazardous material, orders for hot commodities, or shipments with over dimensional freight.

columns.name: EQUIP_MAX_GROSS_WT
columns.description: The maximum permissible weight of the equipment and the load.

columns.name: EQUIP_MAX_GROSS_WT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure associated with the equipment's gross maximum weight.

columns.name: EQUIP_MAX_GROSS_WT_BASE
columns.description: The equipment's gross maximum weight of the equipment in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: FLOOR_HEIGHT
columns.description: Actual height of the platform or floor above the ground or the rail.

columns.name: FLOOR_HEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure associated with the floor height.

columns.name: FLOOR_HEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The floor height in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_HEIGHT
columns.description: When empty, indicates the height from Top of Rail to the Center of Gravity.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_HEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure associated with the empty center of gravity height.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_HEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The empty center of gravity height in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: DRY_CAPACITY
columns.description: The maximum interior capacity of the equipment.

columns.name: DRY_CAPACITY_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure associated with the maximum dry capacity of the equipment.

columns.name: DRY_CAPACITY_BASE
columns.description: The maximum dry capacity in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: LIQUID_CAPACITY
columns.description: The number of gallons the equipment will hold.

columns.name: LIQUID_CAPACITY_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure associated with the liquid capacity of the equipment.

columns.name: LIQUID_CAPACITY_BASE
columns.description: The liquid capacity in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: ASSIGNED_PRODUCT
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: CAR_DESTINATION_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: Specifies destination for the car.

columns.name: CAR_DESTINATION_ETA_DATE
columns.description: This is the estimated arrival time at the car destination.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_LENGTH
columns.description: When empty, length wise position of center of gravity from the equipment bottom leftmost corner.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_LENGTH_BASE
columns.description: The empty center of gravity length in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_LENGTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the empty center of gravity length column.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_WIDTH
columns.description: When empty, width wise position of center of gravity from the equipment bottom leftmost corner.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_WIDTH_BASE
columns.description: The empty center of gravity length in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: EMPTY_CG_WIDTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the empty center of gravity width column.

columns.name: LOAD_OR_EMPTY
columns.description: Indicates whether the equipment is Load or Empty or Unknown (default)

columns.name: SIGHTING_EVT_SC_GID
columns.description: Sighting event represents the current status code of the equipment.

columns.name: PREV_SIGHTING_EVT_SC_GID
columns.description: Previous sighting event represents the previous status code of the equipment.

columns.name: DIVISION_NAME
columns.description: This is the Business Division name field for part of the organization that is responsible for the asset and the business.

columns.name: CUSTOMER_FLEET
columns.description: This is a more granular field for the organization to specify the customer assignment as the customer wishes. It will identify product, location, customer, or any combination.

columns.name: REPORTING_RR_SCAC
columns.description: This is to report the Railroad Reporting SCAC code that provided the last event. It is copied in an agent action called UPDATE SIGHTING.

columns.name: PREV_REPORTING_RR_SCAC
columns.description: This is the previous Reporting SCAC.  The UPDATE ACTION moves the current value to the previous value before overwriting the current value.

columns.name: RELEASE_DATE
columns.description: Every time a car is released, this field is updated by a customer controlled agent action.  It is used to dynamically calculate in-transit time.

columns.name: ARRIVE_DATE
columns.description: Every time a car arrives, a customer controlled agent action will populate this. It is used to dynamically calculate the dwell time.

columns.name: ORDER_SOURCE
columns.description: This is a customer determined field based on an agent action.  Most likely the customer will populate an abbreviated version of the city and state.

columns.name: ORDER_DESTINATION
columns.description: This is a customer determined field based on an agent action.  Most likely the customer will populate an abbreviated version of the city and state.

columns.name: ORDER_CUSTOMER_NAME
columns.description: This is a customer determined field based on an agent action.  Most likely the customer will populate an abbreviated version of the consignee.

columns.name: TRUCK_CENTER_LENGTH
columns.description: The length between the centers of the two truck/bogie systems. Applicable only to rail cars.

columns.name: TRUCK_CENTER_LENGTH_BASE
columns.description: The length between the centers of the two truck/bogie systems in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: TRUCK_CENTER_LENGTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the length between the centers of the two truck/bogie systems

columns.name: TRUCK_COUNT
columns.description: The total number of trucks/bogies on the equipment. Applicable only to rail cars.

columns.name: TOTAL_AXLE_COUNT
columns.description: The total number of axles on the equipment. Applicable only to rail cars.

columns.name: MAX_AXLE_WEIGHT
columns.description: Maximum allowed axle weight. Applicable only to rail cars.

columns.name: MAX_AXLE_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum allowed axle weight in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_AXLE_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum allowed axle weight.

description: Qualifier attributes to store additional information about the equipment. For e.g., Weight Capacity, Volume Capacity, Dunnage, Tare Weight, Length, Equipment Order Description etc.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_ATTRIBUTE_QUAL_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_ATTRIBUTE_QUAL_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

description: Used to adjust cost between equipment groups

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The equipment group that is being 'marked up' if you will

columns.name: CONVERSION_FACTOR
columns.description: The 'mark up' on the equipemnt group. Example: There is a 12% markup if the carrier bids a 48 foot truck.  Specify 1.12 in this case.

description: This table defines the categories that can be used for grouping the equipments. For example, the equipments can be grouped into: 42FT Covered Hopper, 60FT Flatcar, Frozen, Heated etc. The user can also record the size (length, height, width), weight and volume. A link to the defined temperature controls can also be established.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the equipment group.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_XID
columns.description: The XID for the equipment group.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_NAME
columns.description: Describes the group of equipment.

columns.name: TEMPERATURE_CONTROL_GID
columns.description: A GID to define the temperature controls value for the commodity.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_WEIGHT
columns.description: The weight of the equipment.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the effective_weight column.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The weight of the equipment in base units.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_VOLUME
columns.description: The capacity for the equipment.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the effective_volume column.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The capacity for the equipment in base units.

columns.name: WIDTH
columns.description: The width of the equipment group.

columns.name: WIDTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the width column.

columns.name: WIDTH_BASE
columns.description: The width of the equipment group in base units.

columns.name: LENGTH
columns.description: The length of the equipment group.

columns.name: LENGTH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the length column.

columns.name: LENGTH_BASE
columns.description: The length of the equipment group in base units.

columns.name: HEIGHT
columns.description: The height of the equipment group.

columns.name: HEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the height column.

columns.name: HEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The height of the equipment group in base units.

columns.name: TEU_EQUIVALENT_COUNT
columns.description: The twenty foot unit equivalent count for this equipment group.

columns.name: FEU_EQUIVALENT_COUNT
columns.description: The forty foot unit equivalent count for this equipment group.

columns.name: DOOR_HEIGHT
columns.description: Height of the door on the equipment group. Used to check against the height of a ship unit. In many cases, the height of the door is not equal to the actual height of the equipment, which can lead to loading limitations. Use the Door Height field to specify the height of the door so the planning logic can take this under consideration.

columns.name: DOOR_HEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the equipment group door height.

columns.name: DOOR_HEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Door height in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: CURVE_GID
columns.description: Defined the curve function of the curved roof of the equipment group.

columns.name: IS_CONTAINER
columns.description: The is container check box to identifies container equipment groups. Equipment groups with this check box marked are considered during the unitization process that can occur when running the Build Buy Shipment on Primary Leg action for an order release.

columns.name: MAX_LHS_WEIGHT
columns.description: The max weight allowed on the left hand side of the equipment.

columns.name: MAX_LHS_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum left hand side weight for the equipment group.

columns.name: MAX_LHS_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum left hand side weight in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_RHS_WEIGHT
columns.description: The max weight allowed on the right hand side of the equipment.

columns.name: MAX_RHS_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum right hand side weight for the equipment group.

columns.name: MAX_RHS_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum right hand side weight in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_SIDE_WEIGHT_DIFF
columns.description: The max weight difference allowed between two sides (left and right) of the equipment to prevent load imbalance.

columns.name: MAX_SIDE_WEIGHT_DIFF_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum difference between two sides weight.

columns.name: MAX_SIDE_WEIGHT_DIFF_BASE
columns.description: Maximum difference between two sides weight in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: ALLOW_LIFO_ONLY
columns.description: Indicates whether the equipment is for LIFO only.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_PER_UNIT
columns.description: Stores the maximum per ship unit length allowed.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_PER_UNIT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Maximum per ship unit length unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_PER_UNIT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum per ship unit length in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_PER_UNIT
columns.description: Stores the maximum per ship unit width allowed.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_PER_UNIT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Maximum per ship unit width unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_PER_UNIT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum per ship unit width in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_PER_UNIT
columns.description: Stores the maximum per ship unit height allowed.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_PER_UNIT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Maximum per ship unit height unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_PER_UNIT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum per ship unit height in the base unit of measure.

Interpreted as the length from the hitch to the rear of the trailer for Pony-Trailer Truck Type. Interpreted as the length from the front of the vehicle to the hitch for the Dromedary Truck Type.

description: This table stores the details about the individual portions within the equipment group. An equipment group may have one or more compartments. This table records the size (length, width, height), weight and volume information about each compartment. A link to temperature control for each compartment can also be made.

description: This table records the compatibility information between various equipment group profiles. For example a 'Frozen' equipment group profile may not be compatible with 'Heated' group profile.

description: Equipment Marks are a sequence of two to four letters that uniquely identifies the owner of a piece of equipment.

columns.description: The unique sequence of two to four letters representing the Equipment Mark for a piece of Equipment.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION

columns.name: ROUNDING_THRESHOLD
columns.description: To signify the rounding threshold (between 0 and 1). Values equal to the threshold will be rounded down.

columns.name: ROUNDING_GROUPING_LEVEL
columns.description: To indicate the grouping level for rounding. Values include: ORDER, LOCATION, ORDER PLAN TO.

columns.name: IS_INDEPENDENT
columns.description: Indicates whether this ERU is independent of other ERU's. Default is N.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_REFNUM_QUAL_GID

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_REFNUM_QUAL_XID
columns.description: The Equipment Reference Number Qualifier.

description: This table categorizes the equipments from the Equipment table into various categories. The users in GC3 can define the individual equipments, or types of equipments or both.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_TYPE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the equipment type. Equipment Types are used to define the characteristics of an equipment group. Using Intermodal Trailers as an example of an equipment group profile, the group in that profile could be 45' or 48' trailers. The equipment type against that group would be either a rollup or swing door trailer.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_TYPE_XID
columns.description: The XID for the equipment type.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_TYPE_NAME
columns.description: Text for the name of the equipment type.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_DESC
columns.description: A textual description of the equipment type.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_DESC_CODE
columns.description: The equipment description code is a user-defined code for the equipment type description.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_DESC_CODE_DEF
columns.description: The equipment description code definition is a definition of the equipment type description code.

columns.name: ISO_EQUIPMENT_CODE
columns.description: This is the official International Standards Organization (ISO) code for the container that may be used with this equipment type (EDI element 24). This code identifies the size and type of container in a four-character format. The first and second characters specify the volume of the container, and the third and fourth characters specify the type. This code may or may not be the same as the equipment description code.

columns.name: ISO_EQUIPMENT_CODE_DEF
columns.description: The ISO equipment code definition is an explanation of the ISO equipment code.

columns.name: GROSS_WEIGHT
columns.description: The equipment type's gross weight.

columns.name: GROSS_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for GROSS_WEIGHT column.

columns.name: GROSS_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The gross weight in base units.

columns.name: TARE_WEIGHT
columns.description: Weight of the empty equipment type.

columns.name: TARE_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the tare weight.

columns.name: TARE_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The tare weight in base units.

columns.name: NET_WEIGHT
columns.description: The net or nominal weight is the anticipated weight capacity of the shipment that can be contained within the equipment type.

columns.name: NET_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure related to the net or nominal weight.

columns.name: NET_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The net weight in base units.

columns.name: VOLUME
columns.description: The volume of the equipment type.

columns.name: VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for VOLUME column.

columns.name: VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The volume in base units.

columns.name: METRIC3
columns.description: The Metric field represents an additional level of detail for a shipment on a given equipment type. For example, you can enter information about items being transported without packaging, such as a number of garments not packed into crates or onto pallets but instead placed on hangers. This number must be no greater than eight digits.

columns.name: METRIC4
columns.description: The Metric field represents an additional level of detail for a shipment on a given equipment type. For example, you can enter information about items being transported without packaging, such as a number of garments not packed into crates or onto pallets but instead placed on hangers. This number must be no greater than eight digits.

columns.description: Unit of measure for EXTERIOR_HEIGHT column.

columns.name: EXTERIOR_HEIGHT_BASE

columns.name: EQUIP_GROUP_PROFILE_SET_DESC

description: The Eastern Region Presidents Commission Code is a code used in locations.

columns.name: ERPC_GID
columns.description: The unique Eastern Region Presidents Commission Code.

columns.name: ERPC_XID
columns.description: The Eastern Region Presidents Commission Code.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The Description of the Eastern Region Presidents Commission Code.

columns.name: EXCHANGE_RATE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the exchange rate.

columns.name: EXCHANGE_RATE_XID
columns.description: The XID for the exchange rate.

columns.name: MAXIMUM_PRECISION
columns.description: Limits the amount of digits for the whole and fractional part when using the exchange rate. The total number of digits is split variably between the whole and the fractional part of the exchange rate. If you leave the field empty, the precision is assumed to be 38 digits.

columns.name: FRACTIONAL_DIGITS
columns.description: Limits the amount of digits for the fractional part when using the exchange rate. The European Union, for example, standardizes all currency calculations to six significant figures.

columns.name: IS_OVERRIDE
columns.description: A Y/N flag to indicate searching the default exchange rate record for all rates not specifically outlined in this exchange rate data.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: A description of the exchange rate.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

columns.name: EXPECTED_RESPONSE_TIME
columns.description: Used in notify as guaranteed delivery.  Set the expected response time in second from receiving external system.

columns.name: IS_GUARANTEED_DELIVERY
columns.description: Flag that indicates whether the notification is a guaranteed delivery.  A guaranteed delivery is a special type of notification where the receiver sends response back to the sender indicating whether the received message can be /or has been processed.

columns.name: SOCKET_TIMEOUT
columns.description: HTTP read/write timeount in seconds. A value of 0 means no timeout.

columns.name: ACTIVE_MODE
columns.description: Used to enable or disable sending to the external system.  When set to Enabled it will generate and send the xml (default mode); Disable Send will generate and store the xml without sending; Disable Build will log an entry in the i_transmission and i_transaction tables without generating the xml blob; and Disabled will not log, generate, or send.

columns.name: IS_ENABLE_DEBUG
columns.description: Specifies if debugging is enabled for the external system.

columns.name: IS_LOG_RESPONSE_MSG
columns.description: Specifies if the response received should be logged.

columns.name: REATTEMPT_MODE
columns.description: Specifies the type of logic used to setup reattempts to send to the external system.  If None, no reattempts are made.  If Redo, then the status of the transmission will be set to REDO when an error occurs and the REDO transmission processing will manage a resend.  If Delay, then the reattempt_delay field is used to indicate how long to wait before the next attempt.

columns.name: REATTEMPT_MAX
columns.description: Specifies the max number of attempts to send the transmission to the external system.

columns.name: REATTEMPT_DELAY
columns.description: Specifies the amount of time to wait before another attempt to send can be made.

columns.name: REATTEMPT_DEADLINE
columns.description: Specifies the max time from when the transmission is created that an attempt will be made to send the transmission.

columns.name: MAX_THREADS
columns.description: Specifies the max number of threads that should be used for this external system.  This should help limit a bad destination taking up all the threads.

columns.name: FTP_APPEND_FILE
columns.description: Specifies if the FTP protocol should use the append file mode to send the data to the FTP server in batches, or should use the put mode where the whole transmission is sent at once.

columns.name: HTTP_ACK_EXPECTED
columns.description: Specifies if the Transmission Ack is expected to be received when sending via synchronous protocol.

columns.name: HTTP_USE_ACK_STATUS
columns.description: Specifies if the Transmission Ack status should be used as the status of the Transmission

columns.name: HTTP_READ_RESPONSE
columns.description: Specifies if the HTTP response conde should be validated.

columns.name: SERVICE_ACK_EXPECTED
columns.description: Specifies if the Transmission Ack is expected to be received when sending via synchronous protocol.

columns.name: SERVICE_USE_ACK_STATUS
columns.description: Specifies if the Transmission Ack status should be used as the status of the Transmission

columns.name: BPEL_ACK_EXPECTED
columns.description: Specifies if the Transmission Ack is expected to be received when sending via synchronous protocol.

columns.name: BPEL_USE_ACK_STATUS
columns.description: Specifies if the Transmission Ack status should be used as the status of the Transmission

columns.name: BPEL_DOMAIN_PW
columns.description: Specifies the password for the BPEL domain.

columns.name: BPEL_JNS_USER
columns.description: Specifies the java.naming.security.principal property for connecting to the BPEL instance using RMI.

columns.name: BPEL_JNS_PW
columns.description: Specifies the java.naming.security.credentials property for connecting to the BPEL instance using RMI.

columns.name: BPEL_MODE
columns.description: Specifies if the BPEL notify method should use RMI or SERVICE to send to the BPEL server.

columns.name: HTTP_CLOSE_CONNECTION
columns.description: If it is 'Y', close the HTTPPOST connection

columns.name: DELAYED_STREAM_TRANSPORT
columns.description: If it is 'Y', the XML is loaded before sending out and transported through data stream

columns.name: USE_PROXY_SERVER
columns.description: Determines whether the messages or request should be passed through the proxy server or not.

columns.name: INCLUDE_NAMESPACE
columns.description: NULL, NONE, DEFAULT and STRICT to be allowable values

columns.name: FTP_PORT

description: Main table that stores the list of KPIs.

description: This table defines the target value type for each KPIs target type. Example, KPI (Tender Performance) TARGET is FIXED 97%, or KPI (Tender Performance) FORECAST is FIXED 100%, or KPI (Cost Per Lane) TARGET is USER_DEFINED. For FIXED type, TARGET_VALUE should stores the fixed value. For MOVING_AVERAGE, TARGET_VALUE stores the number of months.
This table stores the various types of targets in the system. Example, TARGET, INDUSTRY_BENCHMARK, FORECAST. This table should usually only contain PUBLIC data.

This table stores the types of values that the Targets can contain. Example, the targets can be FIXED values (97% Tender performance always), MOVING_AVERAGE (Target for this month is the Average of last 3 months actuals), or USER_ENTERED (manually entered by the user for each period). This table should usually only contain PUBLIC data.

columns.description: The basic chemical description of the substance

columns.name: CRIT_SAFETY_INDEX
columns.description: A measurement for packages containing fissile material that is determined by dividing the number 50 by the smaller of the numbers determined using the rules in section 10.6.2.4.3 of the DG Regulation Guide

columns.name: IDG_ADD_DESC_INFO
columns.description: Hazmat IDG additional description information

columns.description: Outer Packing count

columns.description: Flag to indicate the pkg is an 'overpack'

columns.name: PACKAGE_TYPE
columns.description: Hazmat Package type of the Dangerous Goods shipment.

columns.name: PACKING_COUNT
columns.description: Packing Count (number of packaged units)

columns.name: PACKING_INSTRUCTIONS
columns.description: Required for dangerous goods shipments, unless the DG class is radioactive or Not Restricted.See Table 4.2 columns G, I, or K of the IATA DG Regulations.

columns.name: PHYSICAL_FORM
columns.description: A description of the physical form of the radioactive substance :                                                                                                              S(p)ecial (S)olid (L)iquid (G)as

columns.name: Q_VALUE
columns.description: Ratio used to indicate that the combined quantities in 'all packed in one' package are within the maximum allowable limits.

columns.name: HAZ_QUANTITY
columns.description: Hazmat item quantity

columns.name: RADIOACTIVE_LABEL
columns.description: The type of label on the shipment.     W1 (White I) Y2 (Yellow II) Y3 (Yellow III)

columns.name: RAD_PACKAGING
columns.description: A description of the type of packaging the substance is contained in.  Acceptable package types are listed in section 10.5 of the DG Regulations Guide:             Expected  ( Expected ) Industrial ip1  ( Industrial Type 1(IP-1) ) Industrial ip2  ( Industrial Type 2(IP-2) ) Industrial ip3  ( Industrial Type 3(IP-3) ) Type a   ( Type A  )    Type b(m)  ( Type B(M) ) Type b(u)  ( Type B(U) )  Type c   ( Type C )

columns.name: RADIOACTIVITY
columns.description: A measurement of the activity of the shipment. For fissile material, the weight of the material in grams or kilograms may be substituted for the activity measurement

columns.name: RADIOACTIVITY_UNITS
columns.description: The units that the activity were mesaured in.  This must be in becquerel units (or multiples thereof) :                                                               Bq (becquerel) kBq (kilobecquerel) MBq (megabecquerel) GBq (gigabecquerel) TBq (terabecquerel) PBq (petabecquerel)

columns.name: RADIONUCLIDE
columns.description: The radionuclide assigned to the substance being shipped.  A table of basic radionuclides is available in the DG Regulation Guide section 10.4.A.  For example, Aluminium (13) has a radionuclide Al-26

columns.name: SUBSTANCE_NUMBER
columns.description: Hazardous Materials substance number.

columns.name: SURFACE_READING
columns.description: The surface reading of the radiation exposure for the package.  This reading must be measured in mrem/h

columns.name: TRANSPORT_INDEX
columns.description: A number based on the radiation exposure of a package. This is determined based on the maximum measurement of the radiation in mrem/h at a distance of 1 meter from the package surface

columns.name: MATERIALS_TYPE
columns.description: Hazardous Materials Type.  Valid values are: l = Limited Quantities e = 500 KG Exemption f = Fully Regulated (Purolater)

columns.name: UNITS
columns.description: IATA units for Non UPS shipments (L=>Liters g=>Grams kg=>Kilograms kg G=>Kilograms Gross).

columns.name: EXTERNAL_CODE

description: Basic Hours of Service rule.  Building block for creating HOS Rule Set Option.

columns.name: HOS_ACTIVITY_TYPE
columns.description: Activity type corresponding to activity time is: D-drive, W-work, or R-rest.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVITY_TIME_MAX
columns.description: Y- Activity time is a maximum time.N- Activity time is a minimum.

columns.name: ALLOW_REST
columns.description: Y - Rest duration will be inserted when max activity time is reached. N - If max activity time is exceeded, rule will be in violation.  No rest duration is inserted.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVITY_TIME_CONTIGUOUS
columns.description: Only applicable if IS_ACTIVITY_TIME_MAX is 'N'.

columns.name: IS_REST_TRIGGERED_BY_WORK
columns.description: Y- rest duration can be triggered during work activity or drive activity. N- rest duration can only be triggered during drive activity.

columns.name: MIN_RESET_SEPARATION
columns.description: Minimum duration required between the start of two resets

columns.name: RESET_START_WINDOW_BEGIN
columns.description: Earliest time of day that counting can start for a reset break. Time is stored in milliseconds.

columns.name: RESET_START_WINDOW_END
columns.description: Latest time of day that counting can start for a reset break. Time is stored in milliseconds.

columns.name: CONSIDER_EARLY_REST
columns.description: This field enables a layover to occur without completely expiring available activity time and without naturally encountering a wait time long enough to qualify as a layover.

description: A set of HOS Rules that will make a driver legal if all are honored.

description: This table stores the standard incoterms used in the transportation industry. The incoterms are associated with an order or shipment. Incoterms are the internationally accepted definitions for terms of sale legislated by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC). The Incoterms further assign each party their respective performance responsibilities, elements of cost, and risks. The inclusion of incoterms in a sales agreement commits the buyer and seller to a strict interpretation of the standard definitions. Some examples of incoterms include: EXW  EX works, FAS - Free alongside ship FOB - Free on board vessel, CFR - Cost and Freight, CIF - Cost, Insurance and Freight, DES - Delivered ex ship, DEQ - Delivered ex quay (duty paid) etc.

columns.name: UPDATE_FLAG
columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated.  If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier.  If the value is either UPDATE_OK or UPDATE_NOT_OK, then the rule is in effect, meaning only one value is allowed for a given qualifier.  In the case of UPDATE_NOT_OK, the value may not be modified.
