description: This is the item master table. It defines the various items in the customer's database. The item can be defined in various governmental classification categories. GC3 includes the categories to represent NMFC, STCC, HTS and SITC. Other details like, minimum, maximum shipping units, pallet size etc. are also defined in this table.

columns.name: ITEM_GID
columns.description: The GID for the item.

columns.name: ITEM_XID
columns.description: The XID for the item.

columns.name: ITEM_NAME
columns.description: Text for the name of the item.

columns.name: COMMODITY_GID
columns.description: The GID for the commodity.

columns.name: NMFC_ARTICLE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the National Motor Freight Classification (NMFC) article/item number. The NMFC article refers to the NMFC's standard grouping of items, for example the article Brick(s): Thermal energy storage, ceramic is identified with the item number of 32270. The intended use for this table is to assign the item number related to the NMFC article as the ID for the NMFC Article XID. Note that within the system the NMFC article and the relationship between the article and the NMFC freight class are for information only.

columns.name: NMFC_CLASS_GID
columns.description: The GID for the National Motor Freight Classification (NMFC). The NMFC is a critical piece of information used for rating Less-Than-Truckload shipments in North America. If you intend to rate shipments using RATEWAREXL or RATEWAREXL WITH CARRIERCONNECT it's important that the NMFC class information entered is a standard NMFC freight class - for example, 50, 55, 60, 65, 70, 77.5 etc.

columns.name: INDICATOR
columns.description: Indicators are icons that can be assigned to business objects that can be displayed in search Results pages and other lists to indicate the condition or state of a business object. You can use indicators to mark the history, status or any other condition of a business object.

columns.name: USER_DEFINED1_ICON_GID
columns.description: The GID for the user defined image/icon. Up to five User-Defined Image fields can be configured to appear on the Search and Results page that let you query and review the images that are assigned to a business object. Images can be assigned to business objects to visually emphasize certain characteristics such as shipments containing hazardous material, orders for hot commodities, or shipments with over dimensional freight.

columns.name: UPDATE_FLAG
columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated. If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier. If the value is either UPDATE_OK or UPDATE_NOT_OK, then the rule is in effect, meaning only one value is allowed for a given qualifier. In the case of UPDATE_NOT_OK, the value may not be modified.

description: This table defines the path between two locations. The itinerary is described in terms of the legs. An itinerary can have one or more legs. The itinerary table consists of the constraints on the weight allowed for shipment for each path. The itinerary can be used by a corporation or can specify additional constraints using the calendar GID like Monday-Friday Itinerary, Weekend Itinerary etc.

columns.name: ITINERARY_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the itinerary.

columns.name: ITINERARY_XID
columns.description: Contains the XID for the itinerary.

columns.name: ITINERARY_NAME
columns.description: Contains the name for the itinerary.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Contains text describing the itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT
columns.description: Contains the minimum weight for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the minimum weight.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT
columns.description: Contains the maximum weight for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum weight.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum weight in base units.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME
columns.description: Contains the minimum volume for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the minimum volume.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Minimum volume in base units.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME
columns.description: Contains the maximum volume for the shipment on the itinerary.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum volume.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Maximum volume in base units.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the corporation profile used for the itinerary.

columns.name: CALENDAR_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the calendar.

columns.name: X_LANE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the entity. It is created by concatenating the Domain Name,'.' and the XID.

columns.name: IS_MULTI_STOP
columns.description: Describes whether the itinerary contains more than one stop. If so, this column contains a Y for yes; if not it contains an N for no.

columns.name: PERSPECTIVE
columns.description: The perspective determines whether the itinerary is used for buy or sell shipment services. Perspective options include All (used for Buy and Sell), Buy, Sell.

columns.name: TOTAL_COST
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_COST_GID
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_COST_BASE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_TIME
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_TIME_BASE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: USE_DECONSOLIDATION_POOL
columns.description: Orders matched to this itinerary may use a deconsolidation pool on the destination.

columns.name: USE_CONSOLIDATION_POOL
columns.description: Orders matched to this itinerary may use a consolidation pool on the source.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_WEIGHT
columns.description: Order bundles less than this weight will always go through a pool if the origin/destination of the order bundles fall into consolidation/deconsolidation pools.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the minimum stopoff weight.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Minimum stopoff weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_WEIGHT
columns.description: The Maximum Pool Weight field identifies the highest weight for shipments that use the pool. If both of the max weight and volume fields are populated, the order needs to be less than these two values in order to be routed to a pool. If one field is populated, the order needs to be less than this value in order to be routed to a pool. If both are NULL, all orders qualify to be routed to a pool.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Weight unit of measure for the maximum pool weight.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Maximum pool weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_DELVS
columns.description: The maximum distance between deliveries is used to limit the distance between delivery stops. If the distance between two delivery stops exceed this value, orders are not paired.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_DELVS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum distance constraint.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_DELVS_BASE
columns.description: Maximum distance between deliveries in the base unit measure.

columns.name: TOTAL_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Specifies the maximum number of stops on a multi-stop shipment derived from this itinerary.

columns.name: MIN_TL_WEIGHT
columns.description: This is the minimum weight to make up a nice truckload. It is also used as the minimum weight to go through a pool.

columns.name: MIN_TL_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The Unit of measure for the Minimum TL Weight.

columns.name: MIN_TL_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum TL weight in base units.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_VOLUME
columns.description: Order bundles less than this volume will always go through a pool if the origin/destination of the order bundles fall into consolidation/deconsolidation pools. When doing pool drop swapping, only pool drop shipments whose volume is bigger than this value are tried.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the Minimum Stopoff Volume.

columns.name: MIN_STOPOFF_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The minimum stopoff volume in base units.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_VOLUME
columns.description: The maximum volume to go through a pool.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum pool volume.

columns.name: MAX_POOL_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The maximum volume to go through a pool in base units.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_VOLUME
columns.description: After pool swapping, the system attempts to pull off the orders that are close to parcel weight and ship direct, if the overall solution is cheaper. This volume guides the algorithm to only pull of the one that is smaller than this volume.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_VOL_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the small direct volume.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: The small direct volume in base units.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_WEIGHT
columns.description: After pool swapping, the system tries to pull off the orders that are close to parcel weight and ship direct, if the overall solution is cheaper. This weight guides the algorithm to only pull of the one that is smaller than this weight.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_WGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for small direct weight.

columns.name: MAX_SMALL_DIRECT_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The small direct weight in base units.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_WEIGHT
columns.description: The Max Cross Dock Weight field identifies the highest weight for shipments that use the cross dock. If both of the max weight and volume fields are populated, the order needs to be less than these two values in order to be routed to a cross dock. If one field is populated, the order needs to be less than this value in order to be routed to a cross dock. If both are NULL, all orders qualify to be routed to a cross dock.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum cross dock weight constraint.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum cross dock weight in the base unit measure.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_VOLUME
columns.description: The Max Cross Dock Volume field identifies the highest volume for shipments that use the cross dock.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum cross dock volume constraint.

columns.name: MAX_XDOCK_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: Maximum cross dock volume in the base unit measure.

columns.name: MIN_TL_USAGE_PERCENTAGE
columns.description: The percentage of usage to be used to determine whether a TL is full in bulk plan. This will guide whether direct shipment be kept without routing to pool. It also determines whether pool shipments be kept without routing to xdock.

columns.name: MIN_TL_VOLUME
columns.description: This is the minimum volume to make up a nice truckload. It is also used as the minimum volume to go through a pool

columns.name: MIN_TL_VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for MIN_TL_VOLUME column.

columns.name: MIN_TL_VOLUME_BASE
columns.description: MIN_TL_VOLUME in base units.

columns.name: IS_DEST_BUNDLE_PREFERED
columns.description: If this is selected, when going through the deconsolidation pool process, if there is a cross dock on this itinerary, two or more order bundles have the same destination will not route to the deconsolidation pool. It will route to cross dock later for consolidation at the cross dock and directly go to the destination.

columns.name: HAZMAT_MODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the hazardous transport mode. It can be used to differentiate between goods from different orders that can be consolidated into one shipment for one or more legs of the trip.

columns.name: RANK
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: ITINERARY_TYPE
columns.description: By default, the Itinerary Type field displays Active which means that the itinerary can be used in shipment planning. Choose Inactive if you do not want this itinerary to be considered when building shipments. You can also choose Manual which means the itinerary should not be considered when running the Create Shipment - Bulk Plan, Direct, or Calculate Best Direct Cost actions. However, the itinerary is considered when running the Direct - Show Routing Options action.

columns.name: IS_RULE_11
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: INCO_TERM_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the INCO Term profile. The Incoterm Profile can be used to constrain the itinerary as a valid choice for shipment planning for any order that has the same Incoterm attributes as the profile. Note: If you use this field, you can also specify a Payment Method code on each leg of the itinerary which is then copied to the shipment that is built for that leg (overriding any Payment Method code defined on the order base).

columns.name: DEPOT_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the depot profile. The depot profile defines the lane and Source and/or Destination Depot Location that are considered during planning for service providers that start and end at depot locations.

columns.name: PICKUP_STOPS_CONSTRAINTS
columns.description: The total number of pickup stops for a multistop shipment. It is usually set to be the max of Pickup Stops Constraints of all valid rate offering. This helps multistop performance.

columns.name: DELIVERY_STOPS_CONSTRAINTS
columns.description: The total number of pickup stops for a multistop shipment. It is usually set to be the maximum of the Delivery Stops Constraints of all valid rate offering. This help multistop performance.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_PICKUPS
columns.description: In some cases, it is more expensive to ship to a cross-dock than to ship direct because of the distance from the source to the cross-dock. To limit the distance you want shipments to travel to a cross-dock, enter a numeric value in the Maximum Distance between Pickups/Deliveries fields. If the distance between two pickup or delivery stops exceed this value, orders are not paired.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_PICKUPS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum distance constraint.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_BTW_PICKUPS_BASE
columns.description: Maximum distance between pickups in the base unit measure.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_PICKUPS
columns.description: The distance from any pickup stop to the root bundle's source location can not exceed this distance.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_PICKUPS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the radius for pickups distance constraint.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_PICKUPS_BASE
columns.description: Radius distance for pickups in the base unit measure.

columns.name: RADIUS_PERCENTAGE_FOR_PICKUPS
columns.description: The distance from any pickup stop to the source location divided by the distance cannot exceed this percentage.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_DELVS
columns.description: The maximum radial - straight line distance - from the source to each delivery stop location that can not be exceeded.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_DELVS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the radius for deliveries distance constraint.

columns.name: RADIUS_FOR_DELVS_BASE
columns.description: Radius for deliveries distance constraint in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: RADIUS_PERCENTAGE_FOR_DELVS
columns.description: The maximum radial percentage distance from the source to each delivery stop location that can not be exceeded.

columns.name: IS_MATCH_DECONSOL_POOL_TO_DEST
columns.description: The Match Deconsol Pool to Dest check box sets the pool logic so that it matches orders to deconsolidation pools based on order's destination locations. If this is not selected, Oracle Transportation Management matches orders to deconsolidation pools according to the order's source location.

columns.name: IS_MATCH_CONSOL_POOL_TO_SRC
columns.description: The Match Deconsol Pool to Src check box sets the pool logic so that it matches orders to deconsolidation pools based on order's source location. If it is selected pool logic matches orders to consolidation pools based on order's source locations. If the check box is cleared, Oracle Transportation Management matches orders to consolidation pools according to the order's destination locations.

columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated. If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier. description: The leg defines the path between the source and destination. It identifies other constraints like mode of transportation (only trucks allowed, air mode etc.)

columns.name: LEG_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the leg.

columns.name: LEG_XID
columns.description: Contains the XID for the leg.

columns.name: LEG_NAME
columns.description: The leg name for this itinerary leg. Note: If entering an Itinerary Leg from an Itinerary Leg Detail, instead of entering an Itinerary Leg Name, a Sequence Number is entered.

columns.name: LEG_CLASSIFICATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the leg classification. An itinerary leg classification allows you to apply a specific label to any leg for identification purposes or to associate order release constraints with a leg.

columns.name: SOURCE_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the source location for the leg.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the destination location profile for the leg.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_RADIUS
columns.description: The Location Radius field creates a radius around the destination location. The leg can use any location within the radius with the same role as the destination location. Enter a numeric value and a distance measure (miles, kilometers, or nautical miles) to represent size of the area. You can limit the number of locations that are evaluated by the planning logic when building a shipment by using the Max Location Count field.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_RADIUS_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the destination location radius.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_RADIUS_BASE
columns.description: The destination location radius in base units.

columns.name: DEST_RADIUS_EMPHASIS
columns.description: Use the Location Radius Emphasis field to determine the location that acts as the geographic center for the location radius. Make a selection from the Location Radius Emphasis drop-down menu: Select Order Source or Order Destination to assign a radius around locations defined on the order, or select Leg Location to assign the location defined on the leg. Note: For itineraries based on regions, if the Location Radius Emphasis field is valued, but the Location Radius field is not, destination locations are determined based on the region ID and the location role defined on the leg. All locations in the region with the same location role as the one defined on the itinerary can act as the destination. You can use this method to pinpoint locations in a region as destination that have specific roles, such as airports or seaports.

columns.name: CREATE_SINGLE_SHIPMENT
columns.description: Indicates whether or not there should be one shipment created per equipment needed on this leg (N) or one shipment for all equipment needed on this leg (Y).

columns.name: IS_PRIMARY
columns.description: Check box used to designate the primary leg for multi-leg itineraries. The primary leg obeys the constraints of order releases that use the itinerary. For example, it uses the transport mode, service provider, and equipment that appear on the order release.

columns.name: SOURCE_LOCATION_ROLE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the source location role for the leg.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the destination location for the leg.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_ROLE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the destination location role for the leg.

columns.name: SERVPROV_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the service provider's profile for the leg.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the equipment group profile for the leg.

columns.name: MODE_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the mode profile for the leg.

columns.name: QUALITY_FACTOR_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Contains the GID for the quality factor profile.

columns.name: EXPECTED_TRANSIT_TIME
columns.description: Contains the expected time for this leg of the shipment to take.

columns.name: EXPECTED_TRANSIT_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the expected transit time.

columns.name: EXPECTED_TRANSIT_TIME_BASE
columns.description: The expected transit time in base units.

columns.name: EXPECTED_COST
columns.description: Contains the expected cost for this leg.

columns.name: EXPECTED_COST_BASE
columns.description: The expected cost in base units.

columns.name: EXPECTED_COST_CURRENCY_GID
columns.description: Contains the currency for the expected cost of the leg.

columns.name: ARRANGEMENT_RESPONSIBILITY
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_ASSIGNMENT_TYPE
columns.description: Indicates how equipment groups are assigned for this Leg. A value of 'N' indicates that No Equipment will be used (i.e. it's loose freight), 'O' stands for Optimize Equipment (i.e. run through Container Optimization), and 'R' stands for Re-use Equipment from Previous Leg (or Optimize if no previous equipment is available).

columns.name: CALCULATE_CONTRACTED_RATE
columns.description: The Calculate Contracted Rate check box should be selected if you want Oracle Transportation Management to calculate the cost and service time associated with the leg. When selected, Oracle Transportation Management runs processing to locate a rate for the leg. Oracle Transportation Management searches for a rate based on the lane information and matches that to the source and destination on the leg of the itinerary.

columns.name: CALCULATE_SERVICE_TIME
columns.description: The Calculate Service Time check box should be selected if you want to allow Oracle Transportation Management to select the service time from the rate offering that applies to the leg. Service time is made up of details such as, drive time, work time, and rest time which are associated with travelling from one location to another. For the transportation modes air, rail, and vessel travel, the service times are calculated based on transportation schedules available for each mode. Note: If using arbitrary locations on an itinerary, this check box must be selected, otherwise OTM will not be able to calculate a service time for that leg and when trying to plan the order via show routing options, planning will fail.

columns.name: RATE_OFFERING_GID
columns.description: The rate offering GID.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: The Rate Geo GID.

columns.name: X_DOCK_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The cross dock location GID.

columns.name: HAZMAT_REGION_GID
columns.description: The hazmat region GID.

columns.name: INTERMEDIARY_CORPORATION_GID
columns.description: A GID that represents the corporation that the location represents. The GID contains the domain portion.

columns.name: RULE_11_INDICATOR
columns.description: If this is not null, it identifies the leg as being part of a rail rule 11 Itinerary segment and determines if the shipment built from the leg is tendered or not.

columns.name: RAIL_INTER_MODAL_PLAN_GID
columns.description: This is the rail inter-modal plan GID. E.g. Plan 20 - door-to-door, Plan 25 - ramp-to-ramp, etc.

columns.name: CUSTOMER_RATE_CODE
columns.description: This code signifies what rate is used on a Leg, either 'C' for the Customer's rate, or 'S' for the Shipper's rate.

columns.name: COFC_TOFC
columns.description: Container-On-Flat-Car_Trailer-On-Flat-Car code used along with the Rail_Inter_Modal_Plan_gid to determine the rate.

columns.name: EQUIP_GROUP_PROFILE_SET_GID
columns.description: The GID for the Multi-Modal Equipment Set. The Multi-Modal Equipment Sets allows Oracle Transportation Management to evaluate multiple equipment options within an itinerary for both the multi-leg and multi-stop algorithms. You can specify an equipment group profile set on the leg of an itinerary that supports multi-stop planning. You can specify a single equipment group profile or a set containing multiple equipment group profiles and Oracle Transportation Management will select the best fit equipment group from within each profile and rate it. The least-cost feasible option across all these equipment groups will be chosen.

columns.name: SERVPROV_ASSIGNMENT_TYPE
columns.description: Valid values are O and R, which stand for Optimize and Re-use. 'Optimize' will be the default and allow the system to find the best service provider for each leg. 'Re-use' will force the system to keep the same service provider on this leg that was used on the previous one.

columns.name: MAX_LOCATION_COUNT
columns.description: Allows you to limit the number of locations that are evaluated by the planning logic when building a shipment by using the Max Location Count field.

columns.name: AUTO_CONSOLIDATION_TYPE
columns.description: The Auto Consolidation Type defines the way shipments on this leg get consolidated. Choose one of the following options: No Auto Consolidation indicates that there is no consolidation or multi-stop planning on this leg. Multi-stop into One Equipment indicates that shipments built on this leg are sent to multi-stop algorithm to consolidate into multi-stop shipments with one piece of equipment for each multi-stop shipment. Only the first leg and last leg of an itinerary can have this Auto Consolidation Type. Consolidate into One Equipment: indicates that shipments built on this leg with the same Source and Destination Locations are consolidated together if they can fit into one piece of equipment. Consolidate into One Shipment/Multiple Equipment indicates that all shipments built on this leg will be consolidated into one shipment (if time window is feasible) with multiple equipment.

columns.name: INTERIM_POINT_OPTION
columns.description: The Interim Point Option indicates whether insert all, or best of the interim points of this leg in shipments that are built on this leg. ALL inserts all the interim points for this leg this leg in their sequence. ALL BEFORE DELIVERY add all interim points without validation prior to the first delivery stop on the shipment. BEST only the best interim point will be inserted based on the following: minimum of (distance-from-source-to-interim-point + distance-from-interim-point-to-destination). There are two parts to the interim point insertion from the algorithm point view: changes to build shipment process and multi-stop process. Interim Points for Multi-stop Shipment If the BEST option is selected with the following 2 shipments and each has an interim point: Shipment 1 has Pickup 1 --> Interim Point A --> Delivery 1 Shipment 2 has Pickup 2 ---> Interim Point B --> Delivery 2 If Oracle Transportation Management plans the two shipments like this: P1, P2, D2, D1, then Interim Point B is inserted between P2, D2. If Oracle Transportation Management plans the two shipments like this: P2, P1, D1, D2, then Interim Point A is inserted between P1, D1. If the ALL option is selected, then Oracle Transportation Management inserts all the interim point between in the last pickup stop and first drop off stop. Interim Point for Pool/Cross-dock Shipment When there is a pool or cross-dock involved in an itinerary, multiple upstream-downstream shipments will be created for on one leg. For example, an order going through a pool may have a shipment from the source to pool and from the pool to destination. If there are interim points defined for this leg, Oracle Transportation Management inserts the Interim Points as follows: For a consolidation pool, Oracle Transportation Management always inserts the Interim Points into the shipment that is out of the consolidation pool. If an order goes to a deconsolidation pool and then destination, Oracle Transportation Management inserts the Interim Points into the shipment to the consolidation pool. If an order goes though a cross-dock, Interim Points are inserted in the following way: If the cross-dock is inbound biased, insert the Interim Points into the shipment that goes to the cross-dock Otherwise insert the Interim Points into the shipment from cross-dock.

columns.name: RATE_SERVICE_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate service profile. The rate service profile provides a way to group rate services that have some similar attributes. A Rate Service determines the time required to transport goods from one location to another.

columns.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_CODE_GID
columns.description: Payment method on the leg which will be copied to the corresponding shipment.

columns.name: VIA_SRC_LOC_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The list of valid source VIA locations to evaluate in rating and routing.

columns.name: VIA_DEST_LOC_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The list of valid destination VIA locations to evaluate in rating and routing.

columns.name: VIA_SRC_LOC_GID
columns.description: Used when only a single VIA source location is valid. Will be used in rating and routing.

columns.name: VIA_DEST_LOC_GID
columns.description: Used when only a single VIA destination location is valid. Will be used in rating and routing.

columns.name: PLAN_TO_OPERATIONAL_LOC
columns.description: If Y, shipments for this leg should be planned to a specific operational location such as a terminal at a port.

columns.name: IS_TEMPORARY
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: TRANS_ARB_SEARCH_TYPE
columns.description: Describes when to search for trans-shipment arbitraries.

columns.name: IS_USE_CONSOL
columns.description: The Use Consol check box is used to indicate that this itinerary leg can be used as a candidate for building a consol shipment for a charter voyage or flight.

columns.name: CPCTY_OVERRIDE_LEAD_TIME
columns.description: A capacity override allows you to model specific weight/volume restrictions by transport mode or equipment that can be assigned to any itinerary leg to control whether a shipment can be planned for that leg. For example, some countries or regions have specific capacity restrictions such as bridges that have maximum weight limits. By creating a capacity override and assigning it to a specific itinerary leg, Oracle Transportation Management will override the equipment capacity. For example, if an equipment has a capacity of 30000 pounds, but the capacity override says 27000 pounds, then Oracle Transportation Management will not plan more than 27000 pounds in the equipment. Weight and volume are restricted by service provider as well as equipment group and transport mode. Note: The lower of either the Equipment or the Equipment Capacity Override will be used and the Equipment Capacity Override is used only to reduce the equipment capacity that can be used.

columns.name: CPCTY_OVERRIDE_LEAD_T_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Days, hours or minutes.

columns.name: CPCTY_OVERRIDE_LEAD_T_BASE
columns.description: Equipment capacity lead time in base unit of measure.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: LEG_TYPE
columns.description: N/A

columns.name: ROUTING_NETWORK_GID
columns.description: The GID for the related network.

columns.name: SOURCE_REGION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the Source Region. An order using the routing network must enter the network on a leg that has a source region, and exit the network on a leg that has a destination region. Thus, a routing network will be unusable unless it has at least one network leg with a source region, and at least one network leg with a destination region.

columns.name: DEST_REGION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the Destination Region. An order using the routing network must enter the network on a leg that has a source region, and exit the network on a leg that has a destination region. Thus, a routing network will be unusable unless it has at least one network leg with a source region, and at least one network leg with a destination region.

columns.name: LEG_CONSOLIDATION_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the leg consolidation group. The Leg Consolidation Group makes shipment consolidation easier to control. It allows for order movement grouping in order movement planning to facilitate shipment timing and consolidation. Leg consolidation groups are available for the following: Network Leg, Itinerary Leg, Order Release, Order Movement, and Order Release Leg Constraint. Planning will not set or modify the leg consolidation group values for these entities. These are just inputs for planning. For order movement creation, planning populates the leg consolidation group on order movements. Note: You still need the ALLOW DIFF ORIG LEG GID OMS CONSOLIDATE parameter set to true to allow orders on different legs to consolidate onto the same shipment.

columns.name: DEPOT_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the depot profile. The depot profile defines the lane and Source and/or Destination Depot Locations that are considered during planning for service providers that start and end at depot locations.

columns.name: ALLOW_CROSS_CONSOLIDATION
columns.description: Allow Cross Consolidation check box indicates whether to allow cross-consolidation out of the source location of the leg. This is only used when the destination of the leg is a region and the source of the leg is a location. The purpose of this check box is to model how some deconsolidation pools work, where orders going out of the pool on the same shipment must have gone into the pool in the same shipment. That is, orders coming into the pool on different shipments may not cross-consolidate onto the same out-of-pool shipment. This behavior is enforced when this check box is off. It is on by default.

columns.name: ALLOCATION_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the allocation group. The Allocation Group provides a direct association between the leg and the allocation. This allocation group is used to match the allocation group on the commitment allocation record if the parameter Allocation Group Strategy is set to '1. Use Allocation Group on Leg'.

columns.name: IGNORE_REP_LOCATION
columns.description: This Y/N indicator specifies whether Network Routing logic will ignore the representative locations of the source and destination regions of the leg.

columns.name: AUTO_CONSOLIDATION_TYPE
columns.description: Indicate how shipments on this leg consolidation group should be consolidated during network routine bulk plan. it takes 2 values: MULTISTOP INTO ONE EQUIP: consolidate shipment into multistop shipment with one equipment. CONSOL INTO ONE SHIP MULTI EQUIP: consolidate shipments into shipment with multiple equipment.  This only applies to shipments with 1 pickup and 1 delivery.

columns.name: LEG_GID
columns.description: The GID for the itinerary leg being assigned to the party.

columns.name: INVOLVED_PARTY_QUAL_GID
columns.description: The GID for the involved party qualifier related to the itinerary leg.

columns.name: INVOLVED_PARTY_CONTACT_GID
columns.description: The GID for the involved party contact.

columns.name: COM_METHOD_GID
columns.description: The GID for the communication method.

description: Tolerance thresholds for individual shipment cost/invoice lines.  For given shipment cost/invoice line attributes such as cost type and accessorial code, users may specify tolerance thresholds to prevent auto approval of invoice lines that are too much higer or lower than the corresponding shipment cost.

columns.name: IS_INVOICE_REFNUM_MATCH_ALL

columns.name: IS_SHIPMENT_REFNUM_MATCH_ALL
columns.description: If true, all shipment reference numbers in the LINE_APP_TOL_SHIPMENT_REFNUM table must exist on the shipment to evaluate this rule; if false, only one must exist

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
columns.description: The Effective Date for this Line Approval Tolerance Rule.

columns.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
columns.description: The Expiration Date for this Line Approval Tolerance Rule.

columns.name: LINE_AGGR_CONSTRAINT_SET_GID
columns.description: Constraint Set ID. The constraint set ID is used for aggregating the invoice line items.

columns.name: IS_AGGREGATE
columns.description: If true, indicates that the line approval rule supports invoices having aggregated invoice lines.

columns.description: The applicability of the loading pattern. To cylindrical unit or non-cylindrical unit.

description: Defines various valid load configurations, OSR, orientation, stacktability and row restriction.

columns.description: Load configuration id.

columns.name: NUM_LOADING_ROWS
columns.description: Number of loading rows. Null implies no restriction.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_GID
columns.description: This represents the equipment group that this pattern has been built for.

columns.name: PATTERN_TYPE
columns.description: ROW is used to fill a row in the container, STACK means an individual stack that can be used to fill out a row along with other stacks, FULL is used to fill the entire container, so only one pattern would be used for a container.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVE
columns.description: Indicate if the pattern is active and can be used as User-defined Pattern in 3D.

description: Defined load configuration engine types available in GC3.

columns.name: IS_FOR_SHIP_UNIT_BUILDING
columns.description: Indicates if this load configuration rule is to be used for ship unit building.

columns.name: STACKING_INDEX
columns.description: Stacking index of the ship unit spec. Units with higher stacking index should not be loaded on top of units with lower stacking index.

columns.name: MAX_STACKING_HEIGHT
columns.description: Defines the height this unit cannot be stacked above since unloading would be difficult otherwise.

columns.name: MAX_STACKING_LAYERS
columns.description: Number of layers this unit can be stacked all by itself.

columns.name: IS_STACKABLE_ABOVE
columns.description: To indicate if anything can be stacked on top of it.

columns.name: IS_STACKABLE_BELOW
columns.description: To indicate if anything can be stacked below it.

columns.name: STACKING_RULE
columns.description: This is an INCLUSIVE rule. SAME means SAME items can be stacked together. LIKE means SAME or LIKE items can be stacked together. Null means any items can be stacked together.

columns.name: IS_FOR_SHIP_UNIT_BUILDING
columns.description: Indicates if this load configuration setup is to be used for ship unit building.

description: A Location is a place where transportation related activities occur, such as loading and unloading freight. In addition, a location may represent a corporation, and/or a service provider.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location.

columns.name: LOCATION_XID
columns.description: The XID for the location.

columns.name: LOCATION_NAME
columns.description: The name of the location.

columns.name: PROVINCE
columns.description: The province (or U.S. state) for the location.

columns.name: PROVINCE_CODE
columns.description: The abbreviation for the province (or U.S. state) for the location.

columns.name: POSTAL_CODE
columns.description: The postal code for the location.

columns.name: COUNTRY_CODE3_GID
columns.description: A GID to define the three digit country code.

columns.name: ZONE1
columns.description: The zone where the location fits in.

columns.name: ZONE2
columns.description: The zone where the location fits in.

columns.name: ZONE3
columns.description: The zone where the location fits in.

columns.name: ZONE4
columns.description: The zone where the location fits in.

columns.name: TIME_ZONE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the time zone of the location. Examples of time zones include America/Curacao and Europe/Monaco.

columns.name: LAT
columns.description: The latitude for the location.

columns.name: LON
columns.description: The longitude of the location.

columns.name: SOURCING_GROUP_NAME
columns.description: Another way of grouping the locations.

columns.name: DELIVERY_GROUP_NAME
columns.description: Another way of grouping the locations.

columns.name: REGION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the region.

columns.name: SERVPROV_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the service provider for the location.

columns.name: LOCATION_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location group for the location.

columns.name: IS_TEMPORARY
columns.description: A flag to identify if the location is created temporarily for a certain shipment or order. This location will not be used for other shipments or processes.

columns.name: IS_MAKE_APPT_BEFORE_PLAN
columns.description: A true or false flag to identify if an appointment is required at the location for (example) for pickup, delivery etc.

columns.name: IS_SHIPPER_KNOWN
columns.description: The Known Shipper check box indicates if a shipper is known or unknown. Shippers are considered unknown if they have not filed the appropriate paperwork and gained permission to ship goods on passenger flights. Goods transported by these shippers must be placed on cargo flights. Select Known Shipper if orders coming from this location can be qualified as known, and therefore transported on passenger flights.

columns.name: IS_ADDRESS_VALID
columns.description: Indicates if the address is considered valid (by checking against the POSTAL_CODE_VALIDATE table).

columns.name: RATE_CLASSIFICATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate classification. Examples include: COMMERCIAL and RESIDENTIAL.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the equipment group profile. An Equipment Group Profile is used to categorize Equipment groups by some common attribute or grouping scheme. For example, you can create a Group Profile called Dry Vans that include the 28 FT Dry Van and 24 FT Dry Van (and others if you like) Equipment Groups. An Equipment Group Profile consists of an ID and a Profile Name and a collection of specific Equipment Groups that you associate with the profile. Oracle Transportation Management can use the Profile in planning to limit the Equipment Groups that can be used for shipment planning. When Oracle Transportation Management bundles orders and builds shipments, it checks that there is an intersection between the equipment group values identified on the order bases. Example: Equipment Group Rule

columns.name: SLOT_TIME_INTERVAL
columns.description: The smallest appointment slot interval for the location.

columns.name: SLOT_TIME_INTERVAL_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the location appointment slot time interval.

columns.name: SLOT_TIME_INTERVAL_BASE
columns.description: The location appointment slot time interval in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: IS_LTL_SPLITABLE
columns.description: The LTL Splittable check box indicates whether orders from or to this location are permitted to apply the LTL splitting logic. If the check box is not selected, the LTL splitting is disallowed for orders associated with this location.

columns.name: NUM_OF_ROWS_IN_YARD
columns.description: The total number of rows in the yard of the location.

columns.name: NUM_OF_SLOTS_PER_ROW_IN_YARD
columns.description: The number of slots per row in the yard of the location.

columns.name: USE_APPOINTMENT_PRIORITY
columns.description: Whether or not to consider appointment priority.

columns.name: SCHEDULE_LOW_PRIORITY_APPOINT
columns.description: Whether or not to schedule appointment for low priority appointment that has been bumped off.

columns.name: ENFORCE_TIME_WINDOW_APPOINT
columns.description: Whether or not to enforce the pick up or delivery time window during appointment schedule process.'USE_APPOINTMENT_PRIORITY' takes precedence of 'ENFORCE_TIME_WINDOW_APPOINT'.

columns.name: SCHEDULE_INFEASIBLE_APPOINT
columns.description: Whether or not to schedule appointment if the appointment time available is out of pick up or delivery time window.

columns.name: COUNTY_QUALIFIER
columns.description: County Qualifier is used when calling an external distance engine and using an address type of city instead of postal code. Often, there are two cities or towns with the same name in one state. For example, in Pennsylvania there is more than one town with the name 'Newtown'. If you do not combine the town with a postal code or a county, you may not get the result you want. You can manually add values; however, you probably want to import them from the external distance engine that you are using. The county qualifier needs to correspond with the distance engine that you are using.

columns.name: BB_MAX_CASES_PER_BATCH
columns.description: Maximum number of cases allowed in each batch.  If blank, the system will assume that there is no limit.  If the number of cases in the order exceeds this maximum, then the batch balancer's splitting logic will distribute the cases into multiple batches uniformly while honoring certain rules.

columns.name: BB_IS_NEW_STORE
columns.description: Indicates if this location should be treated as a new store by the Batch Balancer logic.  New stores can only be assigned by Batch Balancer to a DOOR whose LOAD_NEW_STORE field is set to Y.

columns.name: BB_ORDER_SPLIT_METHOD
columns.description: Value of 'CONVEYABLE' causes only conveyable cases to be counted toward max cases, value of 'ALL' causes all cases (including non-con and repack) to count toward max cases.

columns.name: EXCLUDE_FROM_ROUTE_EXECUTION
columns.description: When = Y, this location is excluded from any Route Instance Legs.

columns.name: APPOINT_DISPLAY
columns.description: The duration of appointment display time period.

columns.name: APPOINT_DISPLAY_BASE
columns.description: Unit of measure for ACTIVITY_TIME column. Unit of measure for ACTIVITY_TIME column. The unit of measure of appoint_display column.

columns.name: APPOINT_DISPLAY_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The appointment duration in base units.

columns.name: APPOINT_DISPLAY_START_TIME
columns.description: The start time of appointment view display.

columns.name: PICKUP_ROUTING_SEQUENCE_GID
columns.description: Pickup Routing Sequence and Dropoff Routing Sequence control the routing sequence; how the system plans the sequence of shipment stops that are built from an order.

columns.name: DROPOFF_ROUTING_SEQUENCE_GID
columns.description: Pickup Routing Sequence and Dropoff Routing Sequence control the routing sequence; how the system plans the sequence of shipment stops that are built from an order.

columns.name: POSTAL_SPLC_GID
columns.description: The Postal Standard Point Location Code for this Location.

columns.name: RAIL_SPLC_GID
columns.description: The Rail Standard Point Location Code for this Location.

columns.name: RAIL_STATION_CODE_GID
columns.description: The Rail Station Code for this Location.

columns.name: ERPC_GID
columns.description: The Eastern Region Presidents Commission Code for this Location.

columns.name: RAIL_JUNCTION_CODE_GID
columns.description: The Rail Junction Code for this Location.

columns.name: SERVING_SERVPROV_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The Serving Service Provider Profile for this Location.

columns.name: YARD_ROW_LABELS
columns.description: Comma separated list of labels for rows in a yard.

columns.name: YARD_SLOT_LABELS
columns.description: Comma separated list of labels for slots in a yard.

columns.name: IS_TEMPLATE
columns.description: Identifies if the location record is a template or represents a physical location.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Free text to capture different location types or classifications like customer, vendor site, or stores etc.

columns.name: STANDING_APPT_CUTOFF_WINDOW
columns.description: The cutoff window by which unbooked standing appointments to be released.

columns.name: ALLOW_DRIVER_REST
columns.description: Indicates if a driver is allowed to take a rest period at this location if he runs out of available HOS.

columns.name: APPT_OBJECT_TYPE
columns.description: Indicates the types of appointment objects this location handles.  Shipments, Shipment Groups or both Shipments and Shipment Groups.

columns.name: APPT_SEARCH_DAYS
columns.description: Use the Appointment Search Days field to override the value of the glog.appointment.searchDays property for this location. Set this field to control the number of days to look forward for the first feasible appointment.

columns.name: APPT_SHOW_NUMBER_OF_OPTIONS
columns.description: Use the Appointment Show Number Of Options field to override the value of the glog.appointment.scheduleAppointmentShowOptions.numberOfAppointments property for this location. Set this field to control how many appointments are displayed when running the Schedule Appointment - Show Options action on the Appointment Management page.

columns.name: APPOINTMENT_ACTIVITY_TYPE
columns.description: Appointment activity type refers to whether the appointment if for a drop trailer or live unload scenario.

columns.name: IS_FIXED_ADDRESS
columns.description: Y/N if address is only allowed to be edited by the UI.

columns.name: PRIMARY_ADDRESS_LINE_SEQ
columns.description: The Address Line Number or primary address line sequence number designates which line of the address text box contains the actual street address so when using the External Distance Engine, the correct street address is used.  For example, if you had this address in the text box, the line number would be 2. Care of Someone 1234 Main St.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVE
columns.description: Used to activate or deactivate location. When the value is 'N', it can restrain user from planning order to or from the inactive location; from tendering shipment with inactive location.

columns.name: ADDRESS_UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date on which the details -CITY,COUNTRY,PROVINCE,PROVINCE_CODE,POSTAL_CODE are modified.RPLS checks this date before it starts screening.

columns.name: SRC_ARB_LEVEL_OF_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: Preferred source arbitrary level of service when selecting the source arbitrary for a location during bulkplan.

columns.name: DEST_ARB_LEVEL_OF_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: Preferred destination arbitrary level of service when selecting the destination arbitrary for a location during bulkplan.

columns.name: USE_SINGLE_SERVPROV_RULE
columns.description: This specifies the use of single service provider rule at a location. The options are: null - rule is not used, P - for pickups only, D - for deliveries only, B - for both pickups and deliveries.

columns.name: SHUTTLE_LOT_EQ_GRP_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: This specifies the equipment group profile for the shuttle or parking lot of a location. When a shipment uses one of the equipment groups in this equipment group profile, the location cannot be directly accessed for pickup/delivery and is accessed only through the shuttle lot. In this case, additional shuttle lot activity time is computed and added to the activity time at the location.

columns.name: IS_WMS_FACILITY
columns.description: Indicates if the location is a warehouse management system facility.

columns.name: ERU_GROUPING
columns.description: To indicate orders going to this location will be grouped together for ERU grouping.

columns.name: APPT_ENFORCE_ACT_TIME_SG
columns.description: Enforce Activity Time for shipment group appointments.

columns.name: ADDRESS_VALIDATION_EDE
columns.description: Indicates which external distance engine is used to validate the location.

columns.name: OVERALL_QUALITY
columns.description: Indicates the overall quality of the location.

columns.name: HAS_MULTIPLE_MATCHES
columns.description: Indicates if we have multiple matches for the location after address validation.

columns.name: APPT_CUTOFF_HOURS
columns.description: Service provider appointment cutoff in hours.

columns.description: Service provider appointment duration before cutoff.

columns.description: The service provider appointment duration before cutoff in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: APPT_BEFORE_CUTOFF_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of meassure for the service provider appointment duration before cutoff.

columns.name: APPT_AFTER_CUTOFF

columns.description: The service provider appointment duration after cutoff in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: APPT_AFTER_CUTOFF_UOM_CODE

description: Multiple locations can be grouped into a location group. This table stores the information about the groups.

description: This is similar to the Location_Compatibity table. Two location groups may not be compatible for a shipment via the same truck as an example. If the locations are grouped and the compatibility information is stored in the Location_Group_Compatibility table, it may reduce the number of entries for individual compatible records in the Location_Compatibility table.
This is an alternate method of grouping the locations by creating enumerated profiles. This allows flexibility to group locations in a profile and specify if they are compatible for delivery.

columns.name: UPDATE_FLAG
columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated. If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier. If the value is either UPDATE_OK or UPDATE_NOT_OK, then the rule is in effect, meaning only one value is allowed for a given qualifier. In the case of UPDATE_NOT_OK, the value may not be modified.

columns.name: LOCATION_RESOURCE_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The XID for the location resource group. A location resource group allows you to group location resources such as dock door1, dock door2, and dock door3 into a location resource group such as frozen goods into a group called frozen. Similarly, you can group location resources into a location resource group such as dry goods into a group called dry. While you create a location resource group, you can also assign locations. For each location, you can assign multiple appointment rule sets. These rules sets are applicable to all the resources which are under the location resource group. A location resource group enables you to avoid duplicate configurations for each resource.

description: Contains the valid list of entries of notification content types.   In other words, it a unique identifier for each group of contents that might be in the email (or fax, etc.). For example, a function might be 'SHIPMENT_STATUS'.  A shipment status' email contents would include the shipment_gid, shipment status, date of shipment, etc.  These contents that relate to the function is stored in the LOCATION_COM_MAPPING table.  A function is then associated with a specific event (like 'SHIPMENT STATUS - DELAYED' or 'SHIPMENT STATUS - COMPLETED') within the NOTIFY_SUBJECT table.  People can then subscribe to an event that they are interested in, and then receive an email notification (or another communication method) when that event occurs.

columns.name: NOTIFY_FUNCTION_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: NOTIFY_FUNCTION_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

description: List of valid entries for workflow events that a person might want to subscribe to.  Each subject (event) is mapped to a notify_function_gid, which ultimately identifies the email (fax, etc.) contents to send when that event occurs.   For example, an event (notify_subject_gid) might include 'SHIPMENT STATUS - DELAYED' or 'SHIPMENT STATUS - COMPLETED'.  Each of these subjects are associated with the notify_function_gid of 'SHIPMENT_STATUS'.  A person interested in knowing about these events would subscribe to the subject, and receive in an email (fax, etc.) that might include the shipment_gid, shipment status, date of shipment, etc. (content fields identified through out the notify_function_gid).

columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: UPDATE_FLAG
columns.description: Specifies if the refnum qualifier can exist on the business object multiple times, or is restricted to occur only once and whether the value is allowed to be updated. If the value is MANY, then the object can have multiple values for the same qualifier. If the value is either UPDATE_OK or UPDATE_NOT_OK, then the rule is in effect, meaning only one value is allowed for a given qualifier. In the case of UPDATE_NOT_OK, the value may not be modified.

description: This table and OUT_XMl_PROFILE_D table together specify the outbound xml profiles that can be used to limit the size of xml documents pushed out from gc3 to external systems.  The Out_xml_profile table contains the header record for the profile and defines the 'gid' for that profile.  The out_xml_profile_d table provides the details which comprise a given profile.  Each record in the out_xml_profile_d table indicates a specific 'chunk' of xml that should be excluded from the outbound document.

columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: RATE_DISTANCE_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

columns.name: SHORT_DIST_CUTOFF_BASE
columns.description: SHORT_DIST_CUTOFF in base units.

columns.name: LONG_DIST_CUTOFF_BASE
columns.description: LONG_DIST_CUTOFF in base units.

columns.name: DISTANCE_EXTERNAL_ENGINE_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

description: Indicates the list of valid values for distance types. Examples:  estimate, actual

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Description of the rate factor source.

description: Also known as a lane, a rate geo is a prescribed course for ships, aircraft, etc. that can have costing (or time of travel) associated with it.  A rate geo may be something as general as West Coast to East Coast, country to country, state to state, or as specific as zip code to zip code.  GC3 will always look at the most granular rate_geo it can find.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate geo.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_XID
columns.description: The XID for the rate geo.

columns.name: RATE_OFFERING_GID
columns.description: Indicates the rate offering to which this rate reo record is linked.

columns.name: X_LANE_GID
columns.description: Indicates the lane definition (the from and to geo hierarchies) that this rate geo record will cover.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Links the rate geo record to an equipment group profile that, if provided, will constrain the rate to only use equipment groups identified as compatible based on the defined equipment group profile.

columns.name: RATE_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: Links to the rate service record which, based on the related rate service type, determines how to calculate the timing for a shipment.

columns.name: MIN_COST
columns.description: The minimum charge for a shipment. The minimum charge is absolute minimum charge that applies, so the calculated cost of a shipment will be compared to the minimum charge and the cost will always be greater than or equal to the minimum charge.

columns.name: MIN_COST_GID
columns.description: The minimum charge currency code.

columns.name: MIN_COST_BASE
columns.description: The minimum charge in the base currency.

columns.name: TOTAL_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Constraint value for the total number of stops (pickup and delivery) that this rate can be used for.

columns.name: PICKUP_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Constraint value for the number of pickup stops that this rate can be used for.

columns.name: DELIVERY_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: Constraint value for the number of delivery stops that this rate can be used for.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_ALLOWANCE_PERCENT
columns.description: The allowed amount of out of route distance (as a percent of the direct source to final destination distance) that is free before circuitous distance cost are charged.  Circuity Allowance Percent = (t/d-1)*100 where: t is the allowed total distance traveled between the first and last stop of the shipment. d is the shortest distance between the first and last stop of the shipment. If the allowed total distance is 1500 miles and the distance between the first and last stop is 1300 miles, Circuity Allowance Percent = (1500/1300-1)*100 = (1.15-1)*100 = 15%. The lower the percentage, the more in line the route must be.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST
columns.description: The per distance unit charge for each unit over the included/free amount.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the circuity distance cost.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST_BASE
columns.description: The circuity distance cost in base units.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_PERCENT
columns.description: The rate constraint that defines the maximum circuity percent for the rate. If this value is exceeded, the rate cannot be applied to the shipment. To use this field, you must have a value in the Circuity Distance Cost field. If there is no additional cost applicable, then enter a cost of 0.00.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE
columns.description: The rate constraint that defines the maximum circuity distance for the rate. If this value is exceeded, the rate cannot be applied to the shipment. To use this field, you must have a value in the Circuity Distance Cost field. If there is no additional cost applicable, then enter a cost of 0.00.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The distance unit of measure for calculating out of route percent or distance and related charges.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The max circuity distance in base units.

columns.name: STOPS_INCLUDED_RATE
columns.description: The Stops Included Rate field indicates the number of free stops included in the rate before stop-off charges apply. The source and destination locations count as stops so, typically, the minimum number of stops included in the rate is 2. Additional charges apply for all stops not included in the rate.

columns.name: FLEX_COMMODITY_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the flex commodity profile.

columns.name: RATE_QUALITY_GID
columns.description: The GID for rate quality.

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: MIN_STOPS
columns.description: Value for the minimum number of stops required for this rate to apply.

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the short line cost.

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST_BASE
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: RATE_ZONE_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate zone profile.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location.

columns.name: ROUTE_CODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the route code.

columns.name: DIM_RATE_FACTOR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the dim rate factor.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
columns.description: Date the rate is effective from.

columns.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
columns.description: Date the rate expires, and should no longer be considered for planning.

columns.name: ALLOW_UNCOSTED_LINE_ITEMS
columns.description: Allow Uncosted Line Items (Y/N) is used when there are one or more ratable objects on the shipment which are not charged or considered for rating when rating a shipment using rate record. Selected: Some basis options within a shipment pass through the rating engine without a charge if other basis options qualify. For example, if a shipment contains four line items, and a rate is found that contains charges for 3 of those items, that rate qualifies for the shipment and the fourth line item ships for free. If there is a conditional charge and a minimum charge, and the conditional charge does not apply, the minimum charge will always be applied. Cleared: This rate only qualifies if all basis options can be charged.

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the shipper minimum value.

columns.name: MULTI_BASE_GROUPS_RULE
columns.description: The multi base group rule determines how the results from multiple rate cost groups are evaluated. Values A/M/X. Options are: Add the Cost, Select the Least Cost, Select the Greatest Cost.  Rate Cost Groups allow you to group rate costs together.  Note: To use Rate Cost Groups, you must have rate groups active within your user preferences.

columns.name: RAIL_INTER_MODAL_PLAN_GID
columns.description: The rail inter-modal plan GID.  i.e. Plan 20 - door-to-door, Plan 25 - ramp-to-ramp, etc.

columns.name: CUSTOMER_RATE_CODE
columns.description: This code signifies what rate is used on a Leg; either 'C' for the Customer's rate, or 'S' for the Shipper's rate.

columns.name: COFC_TOFC
columns.description: The Container-On-Flat-Car/Trailer-On-Flat-Car code used along with the Rail Inter Modal Plan GID  to determine the  rate.

columns.name: EXPIRE_MARK_ID
columns.description: Used to indicate that the rate has been marked for expiration.

columns.name: VIA_SRC_LOC_PROF_GID
columns.description: VIA Locations are used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Locations set up on an itinerary. This field provides the profile GID for the profile/list of source via locations.

columns.name: VIA_DEST_LOC_PROF_GID
columns.description: VIA Locations are used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Locations set up on an itinerary. This field provides the profile GID for the profile/list of destination via locations.

columns.name: VIA_SRC_LOC_GID
columns.description: A VIA Locations is used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Location set up on an itinerary. This field provides the location GID for a single source via location.

columns.name: VIA_DEST_LOC_GID
columns.description: A VIA Locations is used when rating and routing international shipments. Rates are valid when the data specified here matches the VIA Location set up on an itinerary. This field provides the location GID for a single destination via location.

columns.name: ROUNDING_TYPE
columns.description: The type of rounding that will occur during rating.  Value are: N=no rounding, I=round to nearest interval, F=floor, and C=ceiling.

columns.name: ROUNDING_INTERVAL
columns.description: Numbers will be rounded (or truncated) to the nearest increment of this value.

columns.name: ROUNDING_FIELDS_LEVEL
columns.description: Determines which kinds of fields will be affected by the rounding settings during costing.  Values are 0-7, where 0=all fields, 1=none, 2=numeric fields only, 3=unit fields (weight, etc.), 4=currency, 5=numeric and unit fields, 6=numeric and currency fields, and 7=unit and currency fields.

columns.name: ROUNDING_APPLICATION
columns.description: Determines when to apply the rounding rules.  Values are A/N/C/O where A=always, N=never, C=conditionals only, and O=cost calculations only.

columns.name: DEFICIT_CALCULATIONS_TYPE
columns.description: When to apply deficit calculations. Values are Y/N/P where Y = Yes, N = No and P = Payant Pour.

columns.name: BUY_SERVPROV_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The ID of the service provider profile to be used when building buy shipments.

columns.name: BUY_RATE_GEO_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The ID of the rate geo profile to be used when building buy shipments.

columns.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_CODE_GID
columns.description: Optional payment method for the rate record

columns.name: IS_MASTER_OVERRIDES_BASE
columns.description: If Y, the BASE rate will not be evaluated and applied for this rate geo.

columns.name: HAZARDOUS_RATE_TYPE
columns.description: Qualifies how the rate should be used for shipments with hazardous materials. The Hazardous Rate Type has three options which can be used to indicate whether the rate can be used for shipments with or without hazardous materials. The options are: Allows Hazardous Materials Hazardous Materials Only Non-Hazardous Materials Only

columns.name: IS_QUOTE
columns.description: Most commonly applicable to spot rates; indicates if this rate is to be found by rate finding logic. During RIQ, if the attached rate offering is a spot rate, the rate geo can only be used if quote is checked.

columns.name: DOMAIN_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Allows you to assign a domain profile ID which defines the compatible or incompatible domains for rate.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVE
columns.description: TRUE FALSE flag indicating if the rate is active or not.

columns.name: RO_TIME_PERIOD_DEF_GID
columns.description: The global ID for the rate offering time period definition which is used to define the time periods for tiered rates.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_SEQ
columns.description: System generated unique identifier for a rate geo. For internal use only.

columns.name: LOGIC_CONFIG_GID
columns.description: Specifies the logic configuration group ID used to look up any logic parameters specified as charge multipliers on costs.  If not null, overrides value specified on the owning rate offering.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
