columns.name: RATE_GEO_DESC
columns.description: The rate geo description.

columns.name: IS_FOR_BEYOND
columns.description: The From Beyond and For Beyond check boxes allow the existence of two rates with the same geography, such as SPLC to SPLC, to exist with one being allowable for use with Rule 11 and the other one not. Since you cannot have the same GID, this allows you to have the flexibility. The For Beyond check box is for a leg going into a junction as defined on Rule 11 Route Code. The From Beyond check box is for a leg going from a junction. Select both check boxes for a leg going from a junction to a junction.

columns.name: IS_FROM_BEYOND
columns.description: The From Beyond and For Beyond check boxes allow the existence of two rates with the same geography, such as SPLC to SPLC, to exist with one being allowable for use with Rule 11 and the other one not. Since you cannot have the same GID, this allows you to have the flexibility. The For Beyond check box is for a leg going into a junction as defined on Rule 11 Route Code. The From Beyond check box is for a leg going from a junction. Select both check boxes for a leg going from a junction to a junction.

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Allows you to constrain the usage of the rate during the planning based the compatibility definition provided by the assigned corporation profile.

columns.name: PARENT_RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: Used for rate maintenance and is provided so you can track the different versions of your rates during the approval process.

columns.name: IS_SOURCING_RATE
columns.description: This column is named as IS_SOURCING_RATE to maintain consistency with RATE_OFFERING table but used to serve the purpose of IS_READ_ONLY in the UI.

columns.name: CALC_CHARGEABLE_WT_VOL_WITH
columns.description: Calculate Chargeable Weight/Volume Using provides you with options for calculating the chargeable weight. If you select this field value as 'Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume', chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume. If you select this field value as 'Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume', chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume.

description: Contains the cost information for transporting goods in a particular geo, and the number of units included per cost.  For example, the cost could be $10 per unit, or could indicate $100 per 50 units.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_COST_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate geo cost group.

columns.name: RATE_GEO_COST_SEQ
columns.description: An internal sequencing number for costs defined on a rate.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Records additional information about the rate cost. This description will appear as the shipment cost type on the Financial tab of the Shipment Manager when this rate cost is applied to a shipment. If this field is left blank, a default shipment cost type appears such as Base or Discount.

columns.name: TARIFF_ITEM_NUMBER
columns.description: The Tariff fields are a set of informational field that let the service provider know the rate being used. The tariff item number can be used for all types of prices. If the service provider assigns an item number or a numeric extension for the authority number in the reference number to the price, then this field can be used to capture that information. The tariff item number is the next step below the tariff section.

columns.name: TARIFF_SECTION
columns.description: The tariff section is the first division of granularity of a tariff and describes where the rate can be found. An informational field.

columns.name: TARIFF_ITEM_NUMBER_SUFFIX
columns.description: The tariff item number suffix, if you have a suffix with your tariff item number. The tariff item number suffix works with the tariff item number. An informational field.

columns.name: TARIFF_ITEM_PART
columns.description: The item part is a subdivision of an item. The item part is like the house number on a street (tariff item number) in a city (tariff section) in a state (tariff reference number).

columns.name: TARIFF_FREIGHT_CLASS_CODE
columns.description: The tariff freight class code specifies the freight classification associated with this tariff. Tariff freight class code references a system where the motor carrier industry has classified 'goods' by their shipping density instead of their composition or use. An informational field.

columns.name: EX_PARTE
columns.description: Stores information related to the authority/government agency that relates to this rate.

columns.name: RATE_BASIS_NUMBER
columns.description: The mileage factor published for rating purposes. This number is qualified by the rate basis qualifier. An informational field.

columns.name: TARIFF_COLUMN
columns.description: A commodity classification that is used, as a means of control, for grouping of commodities in tariff applications.

columns.name: TARIFF_DISTANCE
columns.description: The distance on which the rate is based.

columns.name: TARIFF_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Identifies the distance unit. Select a distance qualifier.

columns.name: TARIFF_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The tariff distance in base units.

columns.name: DISTANCE_QUALIFIER
columns.description: Identifies the distance unit for the tariff. Informational. Values ( A/B/D/F/K/L/M/T/X).

columns.name: RATE_BASIS_QUALIFIER
columns.description: Provides context for the rate basis number. Informational. For example, if the rate basis number is '83' as defined by the household goods miles definition which would explain the geography for the rate basis number. Values (A/B/C/D/E/F/H/M/T/X/Y).

columns.name: RATE_GEO_COST_OPERAND_SEQ
columns.description: Internal sequencing number for costs operand.

columns.name: OPER1_GID
columns.description: The GID for the operator.

columns.name: LEFT_OPERAND1
columns.description: The operator for the conditional. For example, <=: Less than or equal to, >: Greater than, <: Less than, >=: Greater than or equal to, =: Equal to etc.

columns.name: LOW_VALUE1
columns.description: Operand value or low value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: HIGH_VALUE1
columns.description: Operand value high value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: AND_OR1
columns.description: Used to combine conditional rules with values of SELECTED, AND, or OR. If you choose SELECTED, the system first finds matches for the first conditional rule, and then passes only those matches on to the next conditional rule, etc..

columns.name: OPER2_GID
columns.description: The GID for the operator.

columns.name: LEFT_OPERAND2
columns.description: The operator for the conditional. For example, <=: Less than or equal to, >: Greater than, <: Less than, >=: Greater than or equal to, =: Equal to etc.

columns.name: LOW_VALUE2
columns.description: Operand value or low value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: HIGH_VALUE2
columns.description: Operand value high value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: AND_OR2
columns.description: Used to combine conditional rules with values of SELECTED, AND, or OR. If you choose SELECTED, the system first finds matches for the first conditional rule, and then passes only those matches on to the next conditional rule, etc..

columns.name: OPER3_GID
columns.description: The GID for the operator.

columns.name: LEFT_OPERAND3
columns.description: The operator for the conditional. For example, <=: Less than or equal to, >: Greater than, <: Less than, >=: Greater than or equal to, =: Equal to etc.

columns.name: LOW_VALUE3
columns.description: Operand value or low value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: HIGH_VALUE3
columns.description: Operand value high value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: AND_OR3
columns.description: Used to combine conditional rules with values of SELECTED, AND, or OR. If you choose SELECTED, the system first finds matches for the first conditional rule, and then passes only those matches on to the next conditional rule, etc..

columns.name: OPER4_GID
columns.description: The GID for the operator.

columns.name: LEFT_OPERAND4
columns.description: The operator for the conditional. For example, <=: Less than or equal to, >: Greater than, <: Less than, >=: Greater than or equal to, =: Equal to etc.

columns.name: LOW_VALUE4
columns.description: Operand value or low value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: HIGH_VALUE4
columns.description: Operand value high value if the operand requires low/high values. For example where the operator is between: value1 < Basis <= value2.

columns.name: CHARGE_AMOUNT
columns.description: Amount to be charged per unit code and unit count. For example, the amount to be charge is 1 USD for every 3 pounds.

columns.name: CHARGE_CURRENCY_GID
columns.description: The currency code related to the charge amount.

columns.name: CHARGE_AMOUNT_BASE
columns.description: The charge amount in base units.

columns.name: CHARGE_UNIT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The charge per unit of measure. For example, the amount to be charged is 1 USD for every 3 pounds. In this example pounds is the charge unit of measure code.

columns.name: CHARGE_UNIT_COUNT
columns.description: The charge unit count indicates the per amount for the charge. For example, the amount to be charged is 1 USD for every 3 pounds. In this example 3 is the charge unit count - 1 USD is charged for every 3 pounds.

columns.name: CHARGE_MULTIPLIER
columns.description: This is the basis option for which the cost accrues from the Basis field. Values (A/L/S/G/E/I).

columns.name: CHARGE_MULTIPLIER_SCALAR
columns.description: Enter the number of basis options that go with each amount in the Unit field.

columns.name: CHARGE_ACTION
columns.description: Charge action to be applied. Values (A/M/X/D/W).

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMPARATOR
columns.description: Comparator between charges.

columns.name: CHARGE_TYPE
columns.description: There are the following cost types: Charge Discount External Profile

columns.name: CHARGE_MULTIPLIER_OPTION
columns.description: Controls how charge multipliers are applied against the specified cost. Values (A/L/S/G/E/I). There are a set of options:  Add individual multiplier values Greatest individual cost Choose lowest individual cost Collect costs separately

columns.name: CHARGE_MULTIPLIER2
columns.description: The basis option for which the cost accrues from the Basis field.

columns.name: CHARGE_UNIT_COUNT2
columns.description: The number of basis options that go with each amount in the Unit field.

columns.name: CHARGE_UNIT_UOM_CODE2
columns.description: The charge per unit of measure. For example, the amount to be charged is 1 USD for every 3 pounds. In this example pounds is the charge unit of measure code.

columns.name: CHARGE_SEQUENCE
columns.description: Charge sequence controls, in the order that the costs are calculated. Charge Sequence 1 is calculated before Charge Sequence 2.

columns.name: DIM_RATE_FACTOR_GID
columns.description: The Dimensional (Dim) Rate Factor ID links to the definition of the dim rate factor. The dim rate factor calculates the dimensional weight of a shipment, typically for goods shipped via air or sea. The weight is calculated as: Volume of the shipment/Dimensional rate factor. The system uses the greater of dimensional weight and actual weight which is called the chargeable weight. This chargeable weight is used while rating the shipment.

columns.name: ROUNDING_TYPE
columns.description: The type of rounding that will occur during rating. Value are: N=no rounding, I=round to nearest interval, F=floor, and C=ceiling.

columns.name: ROUNDING_INTERVAL
columns.description: Numbers will be rounded (or truncated) to the nearest increment of this value.

columns.name: ROUNDING_FIELDS_LEVEL
columns.description: Determines which kinds of fields will be affected by the rounding settings during costing. Values are 0-7, where 0=all fields, 1=none, 2=numeric fields only, 3=unit fields (weight, etc.), 4=currency, 5=numeric and unit fields, 6=numeric and currency fields, and 7=unit and currency fields.

columns.name: ROUNDING_APPLICATION
columns.description: Determines when to apply the rounding rules. Values are A/N/C/O where A=always, N=never, C=conditionals only, and O=cost calculations only.

columns.name: DEFICIT_CALCULATIONS_TYPE
columns.description: When to apply deficit calculations. Values are Y/N/P where Y = Yes, N = No, and P = Payant Pour

columns.name: MIN_COST
columns.description: The minimum charge for a shipment. The minimum charge is absolute minimum charge that applies; so the calculated cost of a shipment will be compared to the minimum charge and the cost will always be greater than or equal to the minimum charge.

columns.name: MIN_COST_CURRENCY_GID
columns.description: The minimum charge currency code.

columns.name: MIN_COST_BASE
columns.description: The minimum charge in the base currency.

columns.name: MAX_COST
columns.description: The maximum cost is the absolute maximum rate that can be charged. The calculated rate cost is comparted to the maximum cost and the lower of the two values is what is charged.

columns.name: MAX_COST_CURRENCY_GID
columns.description: The maximum cost currency code.

columns.name: MAX_COST_BASE
columns.description: The maximum cost in the base currency.

columns.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_CODE_GID
columns.description: The minimum charge in the base currency.

columns.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
columns.description: Date the rate is effective from.

columns.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
columns.description: Date the rate expires, and should no longer be considered for planning.

columns.name: CALENDAR_GID
columns.description: If the costs being defined is to be based on a calendar provide the Calendar ID.

columns.name: IS_FILED_AS_TARIFF
columns.description: Indicates if this rate cost has been filed as tariff. This is set to 'N' for new spot rates. Users may wish to set up a saved query to notify users if this rate is used.

columns.name: TIER
columns.description: If using tiered rating, assigning a number to this field allows RIQ to query tiered rates by simply specifying a tier number.

columns.name: COST_TYPE
columns.description: Designates the type of the cost. C = Charge, D = Discount, P = Profile, E = External.

columns.name: CALENDAR_ACTIVITY_GID
columns.description: Allows the user to select a calendar activity for the calendar validation test.

columns.name: RATE_UNIT_BREAK_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The main rate unit break profile.

columns.name: RATE_UNIT_BREAK_PROFILE2_GID
columns.description: The secondary rate unit break profile. It cannot have a value if the main profile GID is NULL.

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMPARATOR2_GID
columns.description: The RBI used to lookup values in the secondary rate unit break profile.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_RATING_ENGINE_GID
columns.description: For a cost type of E, specifies the external rating engine GID.

columns.name: EXT_RE_FIELDSET_GID
columns.description: For external rating engine GIDs of type GENERIC, this specifies the fieldset used to call out to the external engine.

columns.name: COST_CODE_GID
columns.description: Tags a cost with an accessorial code. This does not indicate that the cost is an accessorial. It is a way of identifying groups of costs.

columns.name: LOGIC_PARAM_QUAL_GID
columns.description: For a cost type of L, specifies the logic parameter qualifier (of type Currency) which contains the cost value used as the charge multiplier.

columns.name: COST_CATEGORY_GID
columns.description: The cost category can be assigned to one or more rate costs in a rate record. The cost category can then be grouped into cost category sets which can then be used during the driver assignment process. During the rating process, only rate costs whose categories are contained in the specified set will be evaluated. The results will be sorted based on total weighted cost and the best option assigned.

columns.name: CALC_CHARGEABLE_WT_VOL_WITH
columns.description: Calculate Chargeable Weight/Volume Using provides you with options for calculating the chargeable weight. If you select this field value as 'Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume', chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume. If you select this field value as 'Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume', chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER1
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the condition is based. For example, if the condition checks the value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER2
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the second condition is based. For example, if the condition checks the value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER3
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the third condition is based. For example, if the condition checks the value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: OPERAND_QUALIFIER4
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object on which the condition is based. For example, if the condition checks the value for flex field attribute1 = TEST, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the condition is on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_QUALIFIER1
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge is to be calculated. For example, if the charge is based on some flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the charge is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_QUALIFIER2
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge is to be calculated. For example, if the charge is based on some flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the charge is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMP_QUALIFIER1
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge using unit breaks is to be calculated. For example, if the rate break is based on flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If the rate break is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: CHARGE_BREAK_COMP_QUALIFIER2
columns.description: Determines the attribute/qualifier of the object based on which the charge using unit breaks is to be calculated. For example, if rate break is based on flex field attribute1, this column will hold value as attribute1, the flex field column name. If rate break is based on the reference number qualifier GLOG = ORDER_01 then this column will hold the value GLOG, the qualifier name.

columns.name: MAX_DISTANCE_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum distance field is intended to be used to match the rate offering with shipments. The system calculates the distance between the source and destination address of the shipment being considered, then compares that calculated distance to the maximum Distance field value to see if the rate offering matches or is below the maximum distance constraint.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum distance. Usually MI or KM.

columns.name: MAX_DIST_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum distance constraint value in base units.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum weight constraint is used when matching rate offerings with shipments. If a shipment's weight is less than the minimum value, then this rate offering does not qualify for the shipment in question.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the minimum weight constraint.

columns.name: MIN_WEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum weight constraint in base units.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum weight constraint is used when matching rate offerings with shipments. If a shipment's weight is greater than the maximum value, then this rate offering does not qualify for the shipment in question.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum weight constraint.

columns.name: MAX_WEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum weight constrain in base units.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum volume constraint is used when matching rate offerings with shipments. If a shipment's volume is less than the minimum value, then this rate offering does not qualify for the shipment in question.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum volume constraint.

columns.name: MIN_VOLUME_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum volume constraint in base units.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum volume constraint is used when matching rate offerings with shipments. If a shipment's volume is greater than the maximum value, then this rate offering does not qualify for the shipment in question.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum volume constraint.

columns.name: MAX_VOLUME_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum weight constraint.

columns.name: MAX_SHIP_UNIT_WEIGHT
columns.description: The maximum ship unit weight constraint is used when matching rate offerings with shipments. If any ship unit on the shipment exceeds the maximum ship unit weight, this rate offering does not qualify for the shipment in question.

columns.name: MAX_SHIP_UNIT_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum ship unit weight constraint.

columns.name: MAX_SHIP_UNIT_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum ship unit weight in base units.

columns.name: TARIFF_NAME
columns.description: The Tariff Name fields allows you to put the name of the tariff that the rate offering is related to. For example, if this is a base rate offering you can put the name of the tariff that the rate offering is based on/is using.

columns.name: MIN_COST
columns.description: The Minimum Cost field stores the absolute minimum charge that applies for the rate offering.

columns.name: MIN_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for minimum cost.

columns.name: MIN_COST_BASE
columns.description: The minimum cost in base units.

columns.name: RATE_DISTANCE_GID
columns.description: The GID for rate distance.

columns.name: RATE_QUALITY_GID
columns.description: The GID for rate quantity.

columns.name: RATE_CLASSIFICATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for rate classification.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_RATING_ENGINE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the external rating engine.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_ALLOWANCE_PERCENT
columns.description: Circuity Allowance Percent indicates the allowed amount of out of route distance (as a percent of the direct source to final destination distance) that is free/ before Circuitous Distance Cost are charged.  Circuity Allowance Percent = (t/d-1)*100 where: t is the allowed total distance traveled between the first and last stop of the shipment. d is the shortest distance between the first and last stop of the shipment. If the allowed total distance is 1500 miles and the distance between the first and last stop is 1300 miles, Circuity Allowance Percent = (1500/1300-1)*100 = (1.15-1)*100 = 15%. The lower the percentage, the more in line the route must be.

columns.name: TOTAL_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: For rate offerings where the service provider will provide multi-stop coverage, the total stops constraints sets a constraint on the total number of stops (pickup and delivery) that the rate can be used for.

columns.name: PICKUP_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: For rate offerings where the service provider will provide multi-stop coverage, the total pickup stops constraints sets a constraint on the total number of pickup stops that the rate can be used for.

columns.name: DELIVERY_STOPS_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: For rate offerings where the service provider will provide multi-stop coverage, the total delivery stops constraints sets a constraint on the total number of delivery stops that the rate can be used for.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST
columns.description: Circuity Distance Cost is the per distance unit charge for each unit over the included/free amount.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the circuity distance cost.

columns.name: CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_COST_BASE
columns.description: The circuity distance cost in base units.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_PERCENT
columns.description: The rate offering constraint that defines the maximum circuity percent for the rate offering. If this value is exceeded, the rate offering cannot be applied to the shipment. To use this field, you must have a value in the Circuity Distance Cost field. If there is no additional cost applicable, then enter a cost of 0.00.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE
columns.description: The rate offering constraint that defines the maximum circuity distance for the rate offering. If this value is exceeded, the rate offering cannot be applied to the shipment. To use this field, you must have a value in the Circuity Distance Cost field. If there is no additional cost applicable, then enter a cost of 0.00.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Defines the distance unit of measure for calculating out of route percent or distance and related charges.

columns.name: MAX_CIRCUITY_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The maximum circuity distance in base units.

columns.name: STOPS_INCLUDED_IN_RATE
columns.description: The Stops Included in Rate field indicates the number of free stops included in the rate offering before stop-off charges apply. The source and destination locations count as stops so, typically, the minimum number of stops included in the rate is 2. Additional charges apply for all stops not included in the rate.

columns.name: FLEX_COMMODITY_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the flex commodity profile.

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the shipper minimum value.

columns.name: SHIPPER_MIN_VALUE_BASE
columns.description: The shipper minimum value in base units.

columns.name: EXCHANGE_RATE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the exchange rate.

columns.name: COMMODITY_USAGE
columns.description: Indicates if the rate offering is or is not a commodity based rate offering i.e., are rates based on the classification of the freight. Values (F/C).

columns.name: FAK_RATE_AS
columns.description: Freight all kinds rate as commodity. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: FAK_FLEX_COMMODITY_VALUE
columns.description: Freight all kinds rate as commodity value.

columns.name: RM_ABSOLUTE_MIN_COST
columns.description: The Absolute Minimum Base Charge field determines the minimum charge that applies regardless of discounted savings.

columns.name: RM_ABSOLUTE_MIN_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the absolute minimum base charge.

columns.name: RM_ABSOLUTE_MIN_COST_BASE
columns.description: The absolute minimum base charge in base units.

columns.name: MAX_COST
columns.description: The absolute maximum cost that applies, regardless of actual rated cost to ship.

columns.name: MAX_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the maximum cost.

columns.name: MAX_COST_BASE
columns.description: The maximum cost in base units.

columns.name: MIN_STOPS
columns.description: The absolute minimum number of stops allowed for shipments using this rate.

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the short line cost.

columns.name: SHORT_LINE_COST_BASE
columns.description: The short line cost in base units.

columns.name: MIN_LENGTH_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum length constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's length is less than the minimum, the rate offering does not qualify.

columns.name: MIN_LENGTH_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the minimum length constraint.

columns.name: MIN_LENGTH_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum length constraint in base units.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum length constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's length requirements is greater than the maximum length constraint, the rate offering does not qualify.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum length constraint.

columns.name: MAX_LENGTH_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum length constraint in base units.

columns.name: MIN_WIDTH_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum width constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's width is less than the minimum, the rate offering does not qualify.

columns.name: MIN_WIDTH_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the minimum width constraint.

columns.name: MIN_WIDTH_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum width constraint in base units.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum width constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's length requirements is greater than the maximum width constraint, the rate offering does not qualify.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum width constraint.

columns.name: MAX_WIDTH_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum width constraint in base units.

columns.name: MIN_HEIGHT_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum height constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's height is less than the minimum, the rate offering does not qualify.

columns.name: MIN_HEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the minimum height constraint.

columns.name: MIN_HEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum height constraint in base units.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum height constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship units' length requirements is greater than the maximum height constraint the rate offering does not qualify.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum height constraint.

columns.name: MAX_HEIGHT_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum height constraint in base units.

columns.name: MIN_GIRTH_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum girth constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's girth is less than the minimum, the rate offering does not qualify. Note: Dimensional girth is calculated as length + (2xWidth + 2xHeight).

columns.name: MIN_GIRTH_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the minimum girth constraint.

columns.name: MIN_GIRTH_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum girth constraint in base units.

columns.name: MAX_GIRTH_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The maximum girth constraint is used when matching the rate offering to a shipment. If a ship unit's length requirements is greater than the maximum girth constraint the rate offering does not qualify. Note: Dimensional girth is calculated as length + (2xWidth + 2xHeight).

columns.name: MAX_GIRTH_CONSTRAINT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the maximum girth constraint.

columns.name: MAX_GIRTH_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The maximum girth constraint in base units.

columns.name: WEIGHT_BREAK_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the weight break profile.

columns.name: MULTI_STOP_COST_METHOD
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for weight.

columns.name: VOLUME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for volume.

columns.name: DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for distance.

columns.name: DIM_RATE_FACTOR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the DIM rate factor.

columns.name: PERSPECTIVE
columns.description: Indicates if the rate offering can be used for Buy shipment rating (B) or Sell shipment rating (S) or if the rate offering supports Both Buy and Sell shipment rating (A). Values (B/S/A).

columns.name: CORPORATION_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the corporation profile.

columns.name: CAPACITY_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The GID for the capacity group.

columns.name: CM_MAX_NUM_SHIPMENTS
columns.description: The maximum shipments in a continuous move tour.

columns.name: CM_IS_SAME_EQUIP
columns.description: Indicates whether the shipments in the continuous move tour are restricted to utilize the same equipment type.

columns.name: CM_PREV_SHIPMENT_PERCENT
columns.description: The percentage of the empty leg cost allocated to previous shipment.

columns.name: CM_IS_PERCENT_OF_DISTANCE
columns.description: Indicates whether the percent of the total loaded distance is used to allocate the empty leg cost.

columns.name: TARIFF_REFNUM_QUALIFIER
columns.description: Tariff Refnum Qualifier is an informational field that allows you to qualify the Tariff Ref Num field. For example you can qualify the Tariff Ref Num fields with the Tariff Refnum Qualifier fields using standard qualifier that describe the relationship of the shipper and service provider regarding the prices related to the rate offering. The property glog.shipment.tarifffields.active determines if tariff fields are automatically copied from a rate offering to a shipment.

columns.name: TARIFF_REFNUM
columns.description: Tariff Refnum is an informational field that can be used to store the rate offerings related tariff number. The Tariff Refnum should be qualified by the Tariff Refnum Qualifier.

columns.name: TARIFF_PUB_AUTHORITY
columns.description: Tariff Pub Authority is an informational field that can be used to store the rate offerings related tariff publication authority.

columns.name: TARIFF_REG_AGENCY_CODE
columns.description: The Tariff Reg Agency Code is an informational field that is meant to store information about the regulatory agency that the rates are fled with. For example the STB (Surface Transportation Board) or ICC) Interstate Commerce Commission.

columns.name: TARIFF_AGENCY_CODE
columns.description: Tariff Agency Code is an informational field that can be used to store the service provider SCAC or initials of the entity who owns the tariff such as the Railroad Publication Service.

columns.name: TARIFF_ISSUING_CARRIER_ID
columns.description: The Tariff Issuing Carrier field is an informational field that is meant to store information from the service provider related to the tariff. Examples are C, JQ, SCQ, QTAMR, UPLQ, BNQ, X, BC, NSPQ.

columns.name: TARIFF_REFNUM_SUFFIX
columns.description: Tariff Refnum Suffix is a suffix field for the tariff reference number.

columns.name: TARIFF_SUPPLEMENT_ID
columns.description: The Tariff Supplement ID field is an informational field that is meant to provide information related to tariff amendments, revisions, or supplements of the rate authority.

columns.name: TARIFF_EFFECTIVE_DATE
columns.description: The Tariff Effective Date is an informational field that stores the date when the tariff goes into effect or can be used. This is not the rate offering effective date.

columns.name: ALLOW_UNCOSTED_LINE_ITEMS
columns.description: Allow Uncosted Line Items (Y/N) is used when there are one or more ratable objects on the shipment which are not charged or considered for rating when rating a shipment using rate record. Marked: Some basis options within a shipment pass through the rating engine without a charge if other basis options qualify. For example, if a shipment contains four line items, and a rate is found that contains charges for 3 of those items, that rate qualifies for the shipment and the fourth line item ships for free.

columns.name: RAIL_INTER_MODAL_PLAN_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rail inter-modal plan.  I.e., Plan 20: door-to-door, Plan 25: ramp-to-ramp, etc.

columns.name: CUSTOMER_RATE_CODE
columns.description: This code signifies what rate is used on a leg; either 'C' for the Customer's rate, or 'S' for the Shipper's rate.

columns.name: COFC_TOFC
columns.description: Container-On-Flat-Car Trailer-On-Flat-Car code used along with the Rail Inter Modal Plan to determine the rate.

columns.name: IS_ACTIVE
columns.description: Indicates if the rate offering is active (Y) or inactive (N). If inactive (N) the rate offering will not be used in planning. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: HANDLES_UNKNOWN_SHIPPER
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: USES_TIME_BASED_RATES
columns.description: HIDE

columns.name: EXPIRE_MARK_ID
columns.description: Indicates that the rate has been marked for expiration.

columns.name: MIN_DISTANCE_CONSTRAINT
columns.description: The minimum distance required for this rate offering to be valid.

columns.name: MIN_DISTANCE_CONSTRNT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure.

columns.name: MIN_DISTANCE_CONSTRAINT_BASE
columns.description: The minimum distance required for this rate offering to be valid, in base units.

columns.name: REGION_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The Region Group field is an informational region group that allows you to define a set of regions that represent the regions covered by the rate offering.

columns.name: IS_DEPOT_APPLICABLE
columns.description: If the Depot Applicable option is selected, then the depot stops (source and/or destination locations) will be saved to the shipment. If it is not selected, the depot stops will not be saved to the shipment, but they will be charged and saved to the shipment financials if it is defined in the itinerary. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: RECALCULATE_COST
columns.description: For some time-based rates, the shipment cost calculated during bulk plan and build shipment process may need to be recalculated since it is time dependent. The Recalculate Cost option is used to force the recalculating of cost after a shipment is built. This option works in conjunction with the Rerate All Shipments After Bulk Plan parameter as follows. If the Recalculate Cost is set, planning logic will make sure to account for service time-based rating costs when making planning decisions, and that this has the potential for increasing run-time. If Rerate All Shipments After Bulk Plan is TRUE, shipments will be re-rated regardless of the Recalculate Cost check box. If Rerate All Shipments After Bulk Plan is FALSE and the Recalculate Cost check box is selected, then the system recalculates the shipment cost keeping the same service provider and equipment. If Rerate All Shipments After Bulk Plan is FALSE and the Recalculate Cost option check box is cleared, then the shipment cost is not recalculated.

columns.name: TRACK_CAPACITY_USAGE
columns.description: The Track Capacity Usage field when set to Y, and the Capacity Group field if provided, causes the system to track capacity usage during the planning process. If the Track Capacity Usage is N or the Capacity Group field is blank, the system will not track capacity usage during the planning process. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: ROUNDING_TYPE
columns.description: The type of rounding that will occur during rating. Value are: N=no rounding, I=round to nearest interval, F=floor, and C=ceiling.

columns.name: ROUNDING_INTERVAL
columns.description: Numbers will be rounded (or truncated) to the nearest increment of this value.

columns.name: ROUNDING_FIELDS_LEVEL
columns.description: Determines which kinds of fields will be affected by the rounding settings during costing. Values are 0-7, where 0=all fields, 1=none, 2=numeric fields only, 3=unit fields (weight, etc.), 4=currency, 5=numeric and unit fields, 6=numeric and currency fields, and 7=unit and currency fields.

columns.name: ROUNDING_APPLICATION
columns.description: Determines when to apply the rounding rules. Values are A/N/C/O where A=always, N=never, C=conditionals only, and O=cost calculations only.

columns.name: DEFICIT_CALCULATIONS_TYPE
columns.description: When to apply deficit calculations. Values are Y/N/P where Y = Yes, N = No and P = Payant Pour

columns.name: IS_CONTRACT_RATE
columns.description: Informational indicator to identify rate offerings that are managed for a client in a 3rd party logistics provider setup. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: USE_TACT_AS_DISPLAY_RATE_1
columns.description: If Y, the build shipment logic will invoke the rating engine a second time, restricting it's search to TACT rates only, and apply the result to the shipment as a display rate.

columns.name: IS_DIRECT_ONLY_RATE
columns.description: If Y, this rate will only be applicable to direct shipments.

columns.name: HAZARDOUS_RATE_TYPE
columns.description: N - Applies to shipments with no hazardous items, H - Applies only to shipments with hazardous items, A - Applies to hazardous and non-hazardous shipments.

columns.name: USE_TACT_AS_DISPLAY_RATE_2
columns.description: If Y, the build shipment logic will invoke the rating engine a second time, restricting it's search to TACT rates only, and apply the result.

columns.name: USE_TACT_AS_DISPLAY_RATE_3
columns.description: If Y, the build shipment logic will invoke the rating engine a second time, restricting it's search to TACT rates only, and apply the result.

columns.name: DOMAIN_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Providing a domain profile allows for the rate offering to be constrained to the domains in the domain profile and serves as a constraint on the rate offering. If none of the rate offerings have a customer domain profile constraint, then all rate offerings are returned. If some of the rate offerings have customer domain profiles, the rate offerings are grouped by service provider. For each service provider, only the offerings whose domain profile constraint is satisfied are returned. So, given two rate offerings, one with a constraint, and one without a constraint: if the order release domain list is compatible with the constraint, only the rate offering with the constraint is returned, otherwise, only the offering without the constraint is returned.

columns.name: IS_ROUTE_EXECUTION_RATE
columns.description: If 'Y', this rate offering is used for Route Execution only. For migration: old existing rate offerings migrated to the default value ('N').

columns.name: MIN_TENDER_LEAD_TIME
columns.description: The lower bound of a tender lead time. That is, if tender lead time of a shipment is less than this lower bound, rate would be invalid.

columns.name: MIN_TENDER_LEAD_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The minimum tender lead time unit of measure. Days, Hours, minutes.

columns.name: MIN_TENDER_LEAD_TIME_BASE
columns.description: Minimum tender lead time in base units of measure.

columns.name: MAX_TENDER_LEAD_TIME
columns.description: The upper bound of tender lead time. That is, if tender lead time of a shipment is bigger than this upper bound, rate would be invalid.

columns.name: MAX_TENDER_LEAD_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The maximum tender lead time unit of measure. Days, Hours, minutes.

columns.name: MAX_TENDER_LEAD_TIME_BASE
columns.description: The maximum tender lead time in base units of measure.

columns.name: PACKAGE_WEIGHT_MIN
columns.description: Not a constraint. Weight value used when calculating total shipment minimum package weight. During rating, it will be multiplied by the number of packages on the shipment, and accessed by the Minimum Package Weight RBI.

columns.name: PACKAGE_WEIGHT_MIN_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Package weight minimum unit of measure.

columns.name: PACKAGE_WEIGHT_MIN_BASE
columns.description: Package weight minimum in base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_AVERAGE_PKG_WEIGHT
columns.description: Constraint. If the total shipment weight/number of packages > this constraint, the rate will not be considered.

columns.name: MAX_AVERAGE_PKG_WEIGH_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the average package weight.

columns.name: MAX_AVERAGE_PKG_WEIGH_BASE
columns.description: Average package weight in base units of measure.

columns.name: PACKAGE_COUNT_METHOD
columns.description: Determines how packages are counted when testing the Maximum Average Package Weight constraint. L - Use line item package count. U - Ship unit count.

columns.name: MAX_SHIPUNIT_LINE_PKG_WEIGHT
columns.description: The ship unit line weight maximum is used to match with ship unit lines. This field represents the maximum value allowed by this contract for the weight of a single package.

columns.name: MAX_SHIPUNIT_LINE_PKG_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for ship unit line weight maximum.

columns.name: MAX_SHIPUNIT_LINE_PKG_BASE
columns.description: The maximum ship unit line package base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_NUM_OF_SHIPMENT_SEGMENTS
columns.description: The Max Num of Shipment Segments field determines the maximum number of segments on a shipment. A segment is defined as starting when product is loaded on the equipment and ending when the equipment is completely emptied.

columns.name: RO_TIME_PERIOD_DEF_GID
columns.description: The time period definition (if any) assigned to the rate offering for the purposes of tiered rating.

columns.name: EXT_RE_FIELDSET_GID
columns.description: Specifies the external rating engine fieldset to be used when invoking an external rating engine using our generic interface.

columns.name: RATE_OFFERING_SEQ
columns.description: System generated unique identifier for a rate offering. Internal use only.

columns.name: LOGIC_CONFIG_GID
columns.description: Specifies the logic config group ID used to look up any logic parameters specified as charge multipliers.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: IS_TEMPLATE
columns.description: Used to identify rate offerings that will be used as a rate record template for Sourcing. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: IS_SOURCING_RATE
columns.description: Indicates is the rate offering is a sourcing rate offering. Sourcing rates are view only within the system. Values (Y/N).

columns.name: FALLBACK_RATE_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: The fall back rate service will be used for driving the shipment if the regular rate service is unable to drive the shipment. For example, you may typically have voyage information for two months into the future. However, sometimes a possible order will come in for three months into the future. This works for all rate inquiry types. For example, this will enable you to run rate inquiry Network Rate and Route for this order information, using the same itineraries and rates, and get answers for rate and route even though you do not have voyage information that far in the future. The parameter FALLBACK RS NUM OF DAYS determines how many days into the future to allow use of the fallback rate offering.

columns.name: PARENT_RATE_OFFERING_GID
columns.description: The Parent Rate Offering field is used with rate maintenance. The Parent Rate Offering ID provides a way to track different versions of the rates during the approval process. To compare rate versions, you must specify either a parent rate offering ID or parent rate record ID on any template rate offerings or rate records.

columns.name: CALC_CHARGEABLE_WT_VOL_WITH
columns.description: This field provides different options for calculating the shipments total weight and volume. 'Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume', the chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Shipment Total Dimensional Weight/Volume. 'Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume', the chargeable weight/volume will be calculated based on the Sum of Individual Ship Unit Dimensional Weight/Volume.

columns.name: IS_DIGITAL_FREIGHT
columns.description: If set to Y, then fetch rates from digital freight and use them only for tender.

columns.name: MAX_DIGI_FRT_PCT

columns.name: IS_MARKET_RATE

description: Contains the range of number of stops that are included in the contract.  For example, a contract may include 5 stops, but if more are required for the shipment, the carrier might start charging extra.

columns.description: The GID for the rate offering.

columns.name: LOW_STOP
columns.description: Stop off charges are typically defined for truckload rates. In most cases, the base rate includes the pickup stop and the first delivery stop. The rate may also support the option of performing addition stops, but at an additional per stop charge. The additional per stop charges are often specified in a ranges i.e., for stops 3 to 5 the per stop charge is X for stops 6 to 7 the per stop charge is Y per stop. The low stop fields defines the low end of the range for stop off charges.

columns.name: HIGH_STOP
columns.description: Stop off charges are typically defined for truckload rates. In most cases, the base rate includes the pickup stop and the first delivery stop. The rate may also support the option of performing addition stops, but at an additional per stop charge. The additional per stop charges are often specified in a ranges i.e., for stops 3 to 5 the per stop charge is X for stops 6 to 7 the per stop charge is Y per stop. The high stop field defines the high end of the range for stop off charges.

columns.name: PER_STOP_COST
columns.description: The per stop charge for the low high range being defined.

columns.name: PER_STOP_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the per stop cost.

columns.name: PER_STOP_COST_BASE
columns.description: The per stop cost in base units.

columns.name: INITIAL_REST_TIME
columns.description: The initial rest time for the rate service before the driver starts to drive.  This is actually a buffer added to the simulated run, since otherwise it assumed that a fully rested driver is available for the drive.  By adding the extra time, it lessens the chance that an order delivery window won't be met because the driver needed to rest from a previous run before starting the new drive.

Example: rate_service 1 = 'Overnight' rate_service 2 = 'Two-day'  We could create a profile called 'Under two days', and then associate each of the rate services with this profile within the RATE_SERVICE_PROFILE_D table.  The profile links to the OB_ORDER_BASE table.

description: This table is used to estimate the time of delivery.  It stores estimated average speed for ranges of distances, and all includes minimum times. It assumes that the farther the distance, the faster the average speed will be.  Ex: A truck on average might drive 10 miles/hr for a distance of 20 miles, because of the amount of time it takes to drive out of the town, get on the higway, and then immediately slow down to deliver the goods to the next town.  However, if the truck was taking the goods across 500 miles, then the average speed might be 40 miles an hour, since the truck is on the highway much longer.   Based upon a lookup in this table, a rough estimate of delivery can be made.

description: A valid list of rate zone groupings.  This is then used within the rate_zone_profile_d table to group lanes together.   Example of purpose in which you might want to group lanes:  You may want to associate a timeframe of delivery for your lanes, so you would like to create groupings of lanes that share similar durations of time for delivery.  If you are associating a delivery timeframe within a day's estimation, then the lane from San Franscisco to Los Angeles = 1 day, and the lane from San Franscisco to Sacramento = 1 day.  Rather than entering 1 day for each, these could be put in one profile, and then the profile could state that the timeframe = 1 day.  Another lane could be from San Francisco to Philadelphia, which obviously has its own duration, and therefore would not share the same profile.  The profile's timeframe would be stored in the table RATE_ZONE_SERVICE_TIME.

Example of purpose in which you might want to group lanes:  You may want to associate a timeframe of delivery for your lanes, so you would like to create groupings of lanes that share similar durations of time for delivery.  If you are associating a delivery timeframe within a day's estimation, then the lane from San Franscisco to Los Angeles = 1 day, and the lane from San Franscisco to Sacramento = 1 day.  Rather than entering 1 day for each, these could be put in one profile, and then the profile could state that the timeframe = 1 day.  Another lane could be from San Francisco to Philadelphia, which obviously has its own duration, and therefore would not share the same profile.  The profile's timeframe would be stored in the table RATE_ZONE_SERVICE_TIME.

description: The select_list table keeps track of the various select lists in the database

The SERVICE_EXTERNAL_ENGINE table holds data relevant to third party external engines, including which GC3 class handles that engine.  Each entry in the SERVICE_EXTERNAL_ENGINE table refers to an external engine along with (via the SERVICE_EXTERNAL_ENGINE_PARM table) a set of parameters to be passed to that engine in order to calculate service time.  .

The service time would then be associated in the RATE_ZONE_SERVICE_TIME table.

columns.name: ALLOW_TENDER
columns.description: Allow Tender determines whether the system can automatically tender (ordinary tender as opposed to Broadcast or Spot Bid tenders mentioned below) shipments to this service provider. Clear the check box to prevent the system from automatically tendering shipments to this service provider. If you have not loaded any rates into the system but still want to be able to create shipments, you may want to set up a dummy service provider with this check box cleared. You must mark this check box if you also plan to configure Broadcast/Spot Bid tendering for the service provider. Note: Setting up a service provider's tender timeout requirements is done via the Contact Manager Notification Tab.

columns.name: OUT_XML_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Associates the service provider with an out_xml_profile, which helps define the content of outgoing XML to this service provider.

columns.name: RATE_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: Rate Service GID. This will be the default Rate Service used to re-drive the shipment if the service provider does not have a rate offering that matches the shipment

columns.name: IS_ACCEPT_SPOT_BIDS
columns.description: Is set to Y(es) if the service provider will participate in spot bid tendering.

columns.name: IS_ACCEPT_BROADCAST_TENDERS
columns.description: Is set to Y(es) if the service provider will participate in broadcast tendering.

columns.name: IS_LOCALIZE_BROADCAST_CONTACT
columns.description: If 'Y', use the preference /language, etc. of BROADCAST_SPOT_CONTACT. Otherwise, use shipment's LOGISTICS involved party's preference is used for broadcast notification.

columns.name: SPOT_RATE_ADJUSTMENT_FACTOR
columns.description: Spot Rate Adjustment Factor is the percentage factor to be applied to the spot rate for a service provider to adjust the spot rate for service provider performance. For example, 10% means a spot rate of $100 will be adjusted to 100 + 0.1 * 100 = $110.

columns.name: BROADCAST_SPOT_CONTACT_GID
columns.description: Overrides the shipper's primary contact to be used to determine localization preferences for tender notification.

columns.name: DO_CONDITIONAL_ACCEPTS
columns.description: Determines if the service provider can participate in conditional booking.

columns.name: IS_INTERNAL_NVOCC
columns.description: The Internal NVOCC check box identifies whether the service provider acts as an NVOCC (Non-Vessel Operating Common Carrier). If this check box is marked, you can use the Book with Internal NVOCC action from a sell shipment (that is assigned a service provider with this setting) on a job to create buy shipments and link them to a new job.

columns.name: NVOCC_DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: The NVOCC Domain field determines the domain in which the buy shipments and new job are created.

columns.name: IS_ACCEPT_BY_SSU_ALLOWED
columns.description: Mark the Allow Accept By Ship Unit check box to let a service provider partially accept a tender by its shipment's Transport Handling Units. Allowing a service provider to partially accept a tender gives service providers a role on the planning process. A new shipment and tender are created based off the amount the Service provider accepts. The original tender (minus the partially accepted units) is still available for future tendering.

columns.name: IS_COPY_INV_DELTA_BACK_TO_SHIP
columns.description: The Copy Invoice Delta to Shipment check box indicates whether differences between the approved amount and the amount on the actual invoice should be copied to the shipment. So for example, the shipment was $100, and the invoice was $100, but only $80 was approved and this check box was selected. Then the change, or delta, of $20 will be added to the shipment as an extra adjustment charge. This is not supported when the parent/consolidated invoice is approved by total.

columns.name: INVOICING_PROCESS
columns.description: The Invoicing Process drop-down list box determines what type of invoice will be generated for shipments from this carrier. If it is set to Standard, then regular invoices will be generated. If you set it to BOL Back, then a BOL Back will be generated. BOL backs are often used for ocean shipments.

columns.name: LINE_APPROVE_TOL_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Indicates the line approval tolerance rule profile to apply.

columns.name: SCAC_GID
columns.description: The Standard Carrier Alpha Code for this Service Provider.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_MARK_LIST_GID
columns.description: The Equipment Mark List for this Service Provider.

columns.name: IS_MINORITY
columns.description: Select the Minority check box if the business is minority-owned.

columns.name: INCUMBENT
columns.description: Select the Incumbent check box to indicate that this service provider has been used previously.

columns.name: TIER
columns.description: Enter a value in the Tier field to assign a numerical value to a service provider. The tier value is used to signify which service providers are more important than others.

columns.name: SCORECARD_VALUE
columns.description: If you use a scorecard to organize your bids, enter a value in the Scorecard Value field.

columns.name: EPA_INDEX_VALUE
columns.description: If the provider participates in the EPA Smartway program, record it's SIF in the EPA Smartway SIF field.

columns.name: IS_FLEET
columns.description: Only shipments created for fleet service providers can perform fleet related actions.

columns.name: SOURCING_CONTACT_GID
columns.description: The GID for the contact at the service provider who is responsible for sourcing activities.

columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.description: Flag to indicate that service provider is valid for Spot Rating actions

For example, when the value is START DATE, two shipments with the same start time can go into one shipment group. When the value is DAILY, a shipment having the start and end date spanning two days, will create two shipment groups, one for day one and another for day two and the shipment will be part of both shipment groups.To create shipment group on monthly or weekly basis select MONTHLY or WEEKLY option.

description: This is the master table that holds various special services required for transportation, pickup and delivery. A special service differs from an accessory in that the customer does not have to pay for using the special service. An example of a special service can be a pump required to pull the chemicals from a delivery truck.  The special services defined can be linked at the item level or at the location level in GC3. The logic in GC3 checks to see if a special service is required and thus, schedules the pick-up or delivery accordingly.

columns.name: SPECIAL_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: SPECIAL_SERVICE_GID contains the unique identifier for the special service for the item being shipped.

columns.name: SPECIAL_SERVICE_XID

columns.description: indicates the default payable status  of this special service

columns.name: BILLABLE_INDICATOR_GID

columns.name: IS_ARBITRARY

description: Contains a user-friendly alias for a java class associated with a workflow.  Was mainly created so that a workflow could be kicked off by inserting a SQL statement into the PROCESS_CONTROL_REQUEST table through SQL*Plus, rather than having to insert it into GC3 (for testing purposes).  Someone kicking it off through SQL*Plus would just need to know the alias, rather than having to type in the whole Java class in the TOPIC_CLASS_NAME column.  A workflow will be kicked off whether the TOPIC_CLASS_NAME or the TOPIC_ALIAS_GID is populated within the PROCESS_CONTROL_REQUEST table.

columns.name: TOPIC_ALIAS_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: TOPIC_ALIAS_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

columns.name: IS_FOR_PROCESS_CONTROL
columns.description: Specifies if the topic alias is available for use as a process control request.

columns.name: PROCESS_CONTROL_MENU
columns.description: Specifies the hierarchy for the process control menu.

columns.name: IS_PROCESS_SYNC
columns.description: Specifies whether the process is executed or published.  Topics which take more than 30 seconds or so should be published to avoid browser timeout.  Others should be executed to allow for immediate error reporting.

columns.name: PROCESS_CONTROL_HELP
columns.description: Specifies the online help file for the process topic.

columns.name: IS_FOR_BATCH_PROCESS
columns.description: Specifies if the topic alias is available for use in batch

columns.name: IS_LONG_RUNNING_TASK
columns.description: If Y, this topic is a long running task and should be monitored in the LONG_RUNNING_TASK table.

columns.name: LRT_INTERRUPTABILITY
columns.description: Interruptability support: NONE = task cannot be interrupted; INTERRUPTIBLE = task can be interrupted, likely ending in a failure state; RESUBMITTABLE: task can be resubmitted into it's origin queue for handling by another machine

columns.name: LRT_SCA_REQUIREMENTS
columns.description: For long running tasks, determines if the task should be pulled out of the PROCESS_CONTROL_REQUEST table only when resources are available to process it. NONE=task is pulled regardless of resources; THREAD=task is pulled only if an event thread in the queue is available; MEDIATOR=task is pulled only if an event thread is available and the task will not be blocked by the mediator.

columns.name: LRT_INTERRUPT_ON_SQL
columns.description: If 'Y', a task interruption will force the next SQL statement to fail.

columns.name: DEFAULT_LOG_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: Default log profile when per-process action logging is enabled.

columns.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the vehicle type. Vehicle type generally refers to the type of equipment (aircraft) that will be linked to an air schedule. Vehicle types contain door height and width dimensions that must be added to the equipment group so that ship units assigned to that equipment group can fit through the door when they are loaded onto the plane. For example, you can create a ship unit with dimensions of 10 feet in height by 10 feet in width. You can then assign that ship unit to an equipment group. If you create a vehicle type and assign it to that equipment group, then the vehicle type's door dimensions must be larger than those of the ship unit (for example, 20 feet in height and 20 feet in width). If these door dimensions are not larger than the ship unit dimensions and the equipment group is assigned to a shipment, shipment planning produces an infeasible shipment with this equipment group. If you setup your vehicle types without any equipment groups, the system will check the ship unit against door dimensions on the vehicle type 'loose freight' scenario. If you make an association between the vehicle type and an equipment group, then the system no longer does the door dimension check, but does a check to see if the equipment group assigned to the shipment is compatible with the equipment group(s) associated with the vehicle type.

columns.name: EQUIPMENT_GROUP_GID
columns.description: The equipment group related to the vehicle type.  Note: You must create a vehicle type and assign it to an equipment group to use that equipment group for air transport.

columns.name: IS_COMPOSITE
columns.description: Check box used to identify voyages that are composite voyages i.e., the voyage has a transload point.  Composite Voyages -  A composite voyage is a voyage that takes place using two or more vessels. The main vessel is the 'mother' vessel  and can be identified as such when creating a voyage. This enables you to identify which feeder was from the source port and what is the mother vessel discharging at the destination port on the shipment. A shipment's last departure stop must be before voyage's first transload stop. A shipment's first arrival stop must be after voyage's last transload stop. If a transload shipment has a composite voyage, then it will find all transload stops on its voyage and insert them as transload stops on the shipment. The times from the voyage are copied to shipment stops. If there are multiple transload stops in a voyage, then all the transload stops should be together in the middle of voyage stops.

columns.name: LOG_PROCESS_ID
columns.description: It is used to store the log ID with the work assignment bulk plan.

columns.name: APP_MACHINE_GID
columns.description: APP_MACHINE_GID is used to store the application server running the bulkplan .

columns.name: NUM_OF_SHIPMENTS_SELECTED
columns.description: Number of shipments selected by the user for the work assignments bulk plan.

columns.name: NUM_OF_SHIPMENTS_ASSIGNABLE
columns.description: Number of shipments in assignable states for the assignment process.

columns.name: NUM_OF_SHIPMENTS_ASSIGNED

columns.name: NUM_OF_RSI_BUILT
columns.description: Number of resource schedule instances built in the process.

columns.name: NUM_OF_RSI_PULLED
columns.description: Number of resource schedule instances pulled from the database.

columns.name: NUM_OF_WA_BUILT
columns.description: Number of work assignments created in work assignment bulk plan process.

columns.name: MIN_NUM_OF_SHIPMENTS_IN_WA
columns.description: Number of shipments in the newly created work assignment with the least shipments.

columns.name: MAX_NUM_OF_SHIPMENTS_IN_WA
columns.description: Number of shipments in the newly created work assignment with the most shipments.

columns.name: TOT_WEIGHTED_COST_BEFORE
columns.description: The total weighted cost of shipments assigned in the assignment process before assignment.

columns.name: TOTAL_WEIGHTED_COST_AFTER
columns.description: The total weighted cost of shipments assigned in the assignment process after assignment.

columns.description: The total actual cost of shipments assigned in the assignment process before assignment.

columns.name: TOTAL_ACTUAL_COST_AFTER
columns.description: The total actual cost of shipments assigned in the assignment process after assignment.

columns.name: TOTAL_SLACK_DURATION
columns.description: The total slack duration for all work assignments created in this process.

columns.name: TOTAL_REST_DURATION
columns.description: The total rest duration for all work assignments created in this process.

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_DURATION
columns.description: The total transit duration for all work assignments created in this process.

columns.name: TOTAL_TRANSIT_DISTANCE
columns.description: The total transit distance during the work assignment bulk plan process.

columns.name: PLANNING_PARAMETER_SET_GID
columns.description: Input parameter from which we can pull the resource schedule information.

columns.name: STATE
columns.description: Execution state of the WA bulk plan. INTERRUPTED when a user has requested termination but the bulk plan is still running. TERMINATED when the bulk plan completes termination.

columns.name: TERMINATION_TIME
columns.description: Time when the bulkplan was terminated or timed out.

columns.name: TERMINATION_USER
columns.description: User who terminated the bulkplan.

columns.name: TERMINATION_REASON
columns.description: Reason the bulkplan was terminated.

columns.name: AVG_RESOURCE_UTILIZATION
columns.description: Specifies the average resource utilization during work assignment planning

columns.name: TOTAL_RESOURCE_COUNT
columns.description: Specifies the total resouce count available during the work assignment planning

columns.name: SCENARIO_GID
columns.description: The Logistics Network Modeling (LNM) scenario ID for which this work assignment was created.

columns.name: TOTAL_EMPTY_DISTANCE

columns.description: Maximum of all slack durations after work assignments are created in the bulk plan.

columns.description: Maximum of all rest durations after work assignments are created in the bulk plan.

description: Includes a record of driver activities for a shipment. This is the record sent to payroll and used to calculate driver pay.

columns.description: The GID for the work invoice.

columns.name: WORK_INVOICE_XID
columns.description: The XID for the work invoice.

columns.name: WORK_INVOICE_NUMBER
columns.description: The GID for the work invoice from a business standpoint; if a corrected work invoice is generated, this number will be retained.

columns.name: DRIVER_GID
columns.description: The GID of the driver for this work invoice.

columns.name: SECONDARY_DRIVER_GID
columns.description: If driven by a team, the secondary driver ID.

columns.name: DATE_SENT
columns.description: Date this work invoice was sent to payroll.

columns.name: REVENUE
columns.description: The sell side revenue.

columns.name: REVENUE_CURRENCY_GID
columns.description: The XID for the revenue currency.

columns.name: REVENUE_BASE
columns.description: Revenue in the base unit of measure currency.

columns.name: MARKED_FOR_PURGE
columns.description: Indicates this record can be purged as part of the next purge run.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: FILTER_LIMIT
columns.description: This field specifies a filter limit to control the number of records to be assigned per user, for WorkQueues in Workbench designer.

description: This table enumerates the xml builder classes used to generate outbound xml documents.  Each xml_builder defines a 'chunk' of xml that may be excluded from an outbound xml document. Each out_xml_profile_d record points to a given xml builder.

columns.name: XML_BUILDER_GID
columns.description: Globally unique identifier for a given xml builder class.  GID and XID are the same in this case, since only public data resides in this table.

columns.name: XML_BUILDER_XID
columns.description: Domain unique identifier for a given xml builder class.

columns.name: JAVA_CLASS_NAME
columns.description: Fully qualified java class name for an xml builder class.

description: Template XML

columns.name: XML_TEMPLATE_GID
columns.description: XML template ID

columns.name: XML_TEMPLATE_XID
columns.description: XML template XID

columns.name: TEMPLATE_BLOB
columns.description: XML template

columns.name: USE_DATA
columns.description: If it is 'N', the actual data in template_Blob is ignored.  Otherwise, the data is utilized to further restrict the output.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: Description about the template and its usage

columns.name: GLOG_XML_ELEMENT_GID
columns.description: Specify the XML element ID which this tempalte will be applied

description: This table defines the lanes between any two points. The two points can be: - predefined locations (from the Location table),   - predefined regions (from the Region and Region Detail tables), - Hierarchical locations (from Geo_hierarchy table), or - a combination of any part of the address that includes City,   Province, Postal Code, Country or Zone(s). The zones can be any user defined entries including SPLC (Standard Point Location Codes)

columns.name: X_LANE_GID
columns.description: A unique identifier to define the X lanes in the GC3. The gid contains the domain portion. The X-Lane is the user interface in GC3 to define all the lanes.

columns.name: X_LANE_XID
columns.description: GC3 Unique identifier for the entity. Is used for creating the GID

columns.name: SOURCE_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: A unique identifier to define the locations withing GC3. The gid contains the domain portion.

columns.name: SOURCE_CITY
columns.description: The city of the source portion of the location.

columns.name: SOURCE_PROVINCE_CODE
columns.description: The state code for teh source portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_POSTAL_CODE
columns.description: The zip code of the source location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_COUNTRY_CODE3_GID
columns.description: A pointer to the three digit country code for teh source portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_ZONE4
columns.description: The Zones for the source location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_ZONE1
columns.description: The Zones for the source location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_ZONE2
columns.description: The Zones for the source location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_ZONE3
columns.description: The Zones for the source location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: SOURCE_GEO_HIERARCHY_GID
columns.description: GC3 Global identifier for the entity. Is created by concatenating Domain Name,'.' and XID.

columns.name: DEST_LOCATION_GID
columns.description: A unique identifier to define the locations withing GC3. The gid contains the domain portion.

columns.description: The Zones for the destination location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.description: The Zones for the destination location portion of the X-Lane.

columns.name: DEST_GEO_HIERARCHY_GID

columns.name: SOURCE_REGION_GID
columns.description: A unique identifier to define the region code for the source portion of the X-Lane. This is a way to define the X-Lane from a region to another region (or any combination)

columns.name: DEST_REGION_GID
columns.description: A unique identifier to define the region code for the destination portion of the X-Lane. This is a way to define the X-Lane from a region to another region (or any combination)
